title: Cloud Solutions Architect
description:
Hey Humans,
How are you doing? We’re excited to share some news that we believe will brighten your day
In a world where many companies see employees as just numbers, we at HumanIT take a different approach. We celebrate the power of humans every day, fostering a remarkable team of individuals who bring their unique talents, expertise, and passion to the table.
At HumanIT, our focus is on helping you find the job you’ve been searching for. We specialize in international opportunities, whether you’re seeking Direct Hiring positions or interested in Consulting opportunities — we’re here to support you every step of the way!
We’re currently partnering with a leading company that is scaling its cloud architecture team. We’re now on the lookout for a Senior Solution Architect who can design secure, scalable and highly available cloud environments with strong expertise in Infrastructure, Platform, and Security.
Tasks:• Design and build robust cloud infrastructure covering compute, storage, networking, and databases — always thinking scalability, reliability, and performance.• Shape cloud platform architecture standards and guide platform teams in building future-proof foundations.• Collaborate with AppSec and SecOps to define secure cloud environments: IAM, encryption, network security, vulnerability management, compliance — it’s all in your toolkit.• Architect SIEM and monitoring solutions that help detect threats and performance issues before they become problems.• Ensure Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery plans are in place, working closely with Platform & Engineering teams.• Keep everything compliant — from GDPR to PCI DSS and beyond.• Be a tech mentor: guide and support implementation teams to follow architectural best practices.• Translate complex technical concepts into human language for stakeholders, clients, and partners.• Evaluate new tools, services, and tech that help elevate the cloud game.• Create and maintain architectural documentation — yes, the good kind with diagrams and clear patterns.
Skills :• Deep experience in Cloud Infrastructure Architecture (AWS, Azure, GCP – you name it).• Proven experience in Cloud Security (IAM, SIEM, encryption, network security).• Strong understanding of platform engineering and DevSecOps principles.• Experience with compliance standards (PCI, ISO, GDPR).• Ability to mentor, lead, and influence cross-functional teams.• Excellent communication skills (we love techies who can talk to humans ).• Documentation habits that would make your future self proud.
As Humans, we are focused on giving you different perks and better ones such as:An extra salary per year (15˚ month).Budget for your personal improvement such as Training.Health insurance because we got your back.Vacations that increase, year after year.Mobility Program (We’ll explain it to you later, hahahaha).
Ready to Elevate Your Expertise?Send us your CV to<endereço ocultado>, because we will gladly see it and give you feedback!
HumanIT is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or disability.

title: AI Engineer
description:
At KWAN, we don’t just offer jobs - we provide platforms for growth, harnessing your unique skills, passions, and professional background to place you in a project that lets your talents shine. But we don’t stop there: we provide continuous support throughout your career journey, collaborating and evolving together, constructing a brighter future one step at a time.Currently, we are seeking an exceptional AI Engineer who thrives on complex challenges, and is ready to seize this fantastic opportunity.
Responsibilities:
1) FinOps:- Dashboard creation for several 3rd party tools and their costs;2) Audio Transcription:- Configure and use Speech-To-Text model for transcribing audio files;- Handle transcript formatting and metadata extraction;- Optimize the transcription pipeline for scalability and accuracy.3) Postprocessing Transcripts:- Develop a guardrailing mechanism to sanitize transcripts (e.g., redact sensitive orinappropriate data);- Write scripts to analyze transcripts for errors, quality issues, and anomalies;- Store processed transcripts into buckets and link in a structured format with BigQuery.4) Call Success Evaluation:- Build an NLP pipeline to analyze transcripts for success criteria (e.g., meetingscheduled, confirmation received);- Create detection mechanisms for issues like "prompt injection" or incompleteconversations;- Write results back to a BigQuery table and trigger retries for unsuccessful calls.5) Reporting:- Design and generate structured call reports based on transcript and call metadata;-  Automate writing reports into BigQuery or other reporting tools;- Integrate reporting data with external APIs or webhooks for delivery to other systems.6) Workflow Integration:- Use Google Cloud Workflows or Pub/Sub to integrate the various steps of thepostprocessing pipeline;- Ensure end-to-end automation of the process, with error handling and recovery.7) Error Handling and Logging:- Implement robust error logging and monitoring for each step in the workflow;- Set up alerts or dashboards for tracking errors and performance.8) Scheduling and Retrying Calls:- Write scripts or workflows to add failed/unsuccessful calls back into a scheduling system;- Define retry rules and conditions for follow-up calls.9) Data Storage and Management:- Design and optimize BigQuery schemas for storing transcripts, metadata, andreports;- Implement data retention policies for backup and archival.10) API and Webhook Integration:- Develop API calls to external systems for updating statuses, sending reports, or logging data;- Ensure the API integration is secure and reliable.
Requirements:
- Previous experience as an AI Engineer (Artificial Intelligence Engineer);- Extensive experience working with Python;- Knowledge of Google BigQuery and Google Cloud Platform (GCP);- Ability to work with SQL and TensorFlow;- Previous experience with API integrations;- Experience in designing end-to-end workflows using orchestration tools (e.g., GoogleCloud Workflows, Apache Airflow);- Familiarity with encryption, data masking, and compliance with privacy regulations(e.g., GDPR);- Excellent communication skills, problem solving and proactive attitude;- Good level of written and technical English.
Offer:- Empowering Work Culture: Immerse yourself in a supportive, safe, and respectful work environment where every voice matters;- Tailored Career Advancement: Leverage our comprehensive career development program, structured meticulously to fuel your professional growth;- Continuous Learning: Engage in a variety of tech meetups and webinars, designed to keep you at the forefront of the industry;- Community and Fun: Participate in exciting company events, from movie nights and trivia games to dinners and our annual summer gathering.
We believe in work-life integration and encourage team-building and networking.
Not sure yet? No problem! Reach out anyway, and let our team guide you through the best opportunities we have for you.If this offer resonates with your career aspirations and you're ready to embrace an exciting new challenge, we encourage you to seize this opportunity!<endereço ocultado>

title: Partnership and Alliances Manager
description:
Who We AreJolera stands as a distinguished multinational Global Systems Integrator (GSI), a vanguard in delivering comprehensive and bespoke IT solutions to a diverse clientele, encompassing both direct customers and channel partners across the globe. We are driven by a commitment to excellence, leveraging a team of over 650 highly skilled professionals to design, implement, and manage technology systems that are not only effective and competitive but also scalable and value-driven. Our comprehensive suite of services includes the creation of customized technology solutions tailored to specific business needs, in-depth IT assessments and strategic planning, meticulous IT device and infrastructure management, robust data backup and recovery solutions, seamless cloud and on-premise migrations, enterprise-grade security services, and round-the-clock, 24/7/365 quad-lingual end-user support. At Jolera, we believe in empowering organizations worldwide with innovative and reliable IT solutions, and we invite you to join us in this mission.

Position DescriptionWe are seeking a dynamic and experienced Partnership & Alliances Manager who will be instrumental in managing, growing, and optimizing our strategic relationship with Microsoft and associated partner programs. The ideal candidate will possess deep knowledge of Microsoft's ecosystem, particularly around partnership models, incentives, and co-selling motions tailored for Systems Integrators, MSPs, and MSSPs.

Key Responsibilities
- Act as the primary relationship owner and advocate for our strategic partnership with Microsoft, ensuring alignment with both companies' goals.
- Proactively manage Microsoft partner programs, competencies, certifications, incentives, and rebates to maximize partnership value.
- Lead regular business reviews with Microsoft Partner Managers and internal stakeholders to evaluate performance, set joint goals, and identify new business opportunities.
- Collaborate with internal sales, marketing, and technical teams to leverage Microsoft's resources and co-selling initiatives, facilitating market entry and client adoption.
- Maintain expertise in Microsoft's portfolio, including Azure, Microsoft 365, Security & Compliance solutions, and Dynamics 365, to identify and nurture strategic opportunities.
- Track and report on partnership KPIs, analyzing metrics to optimize partnership strategies and performance.
- Identify and drive opportunities for joint marketing campaigns, funding programs, and go-to-market initiatives.

Who You Are
-You are an excellent communicator and relationship builder, skilled at navigating vendor ecosystems, particularly Microsoft.
- You have strategic insight combined with a pragmatic approach to managing vendor relationships and programs.
- You are results-driven, analytical, and adept at leveraging vendor resources to achieve measurable business outcomes.

Preferred Experience
- 5+ years managing strategic vendor and partner relationships, specifically Microsoft Partner Programs.
- Deep familiarity with Microsoft's incentives, licensing, and co-selling models, particularly for Systems Integrators, MSPs, and MSSPs.
- Proven track record in successfully executing joint go-to-market strategies, particularly involving Microsoft's product ecosystem.
- Experience in MSP, MSSP, or Systems Integration environments highly desirable.
- Relevant Microsoft certifications (e.g., Azure Administrator, Microsoft 365 Certified, Azure Solutions Architect) strongly preferred.

Why Join Us
- Opportunity to play a pivotal role in shaping our strategic growth with a key global partner.
- Collaborative, innovative, and inclusive work environment.
- Competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and professional development opportunities.

If you are interested in applying to our website please click on the following link:<endereço ocultado>
Or send your CV to<endereço ocultado>.

title: Lead Technical Business Analyst
description:
Job Description
Hi, I'mGenevieve Moodley, your Recruiter and guide to joining CSG! We are excited to learn more about you and your unique background.

The Lead Business Analyst will workshop & manage customer requirements. Define functional specifications as well as supporting build & test and directly configuring the CSG CPQ and Order Management system.

We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst who will:
- Dive deep into the world of telecommunications. You will develop a detailed knowledge on markets, products, sales, delivery and operations.
- Solve real-world business problems, considering technical, financial, and operational constraints.
- Take ownership of business analysis initiatives and ensure work packages are delivered on time, to expected quality standards and as per scope, as agreed with the Project Manager.
- Take end to end solution blueprints and configure solution workflows and catalogues that implement the design. You will need to consider exception and failure scenarios to create a robust solution.
- Contribute to our methodology to help us do things faster and better.
- Be able to manage client expectations through workshop and feedback sessions.
- Work as part of a team and independently when required
- Be a mentor and lead a team of budding solution designers

Is this opportunity right for you? We are looking for candidates who:
- Hands on experience in coding. For instance, when to use global and local variables, and the concept of object-oriented programming. Technical background and have software configuration/development experience.
- 5-7 years as a business analyst along with telecom billing or product catalog or pricing domain.
- Have strong communication and BA skills, in terms of requirement documentation and business process mapping.
- Experience working as a vendor.
- Hands-on experience with configuration driven systems (Salesforce, SAP, ServiceNow, Siebel, etc.)
- English Proficiencyin a business environment

Our Guiding Principles
Impact
Always help and empower others, whether they’re colleagues or customers. When our employees set their minds to something, great things happen.
Integrity
Do what’s right for our customers and our people while being authentic. We treat everyone with trust and respect—that’s just who we are.
Inspiration
Be bold in the way you think and passionate about the work you do. Test out innovative ideas without the fear of failure.
CSGer Perks & Benefits (Feel free to adjust this by regional benefits!)
- Work from Home, in-office, or hybrid
- Employee Belonging Groups
- Healthcare: Dental, Medical, and Vision
- Paid Vacation, Volunteer, and Holiday Time Off
- And so much more!
If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with CSG and need special assistance due to a disability or accommodation for a disability throughout any aspect of the application process, please call us at +1 (402) 431-7440 or email us at<endereço ocultado>. CSG provides accommodations for persons with disabilities in employment, including during the hiring process and any interview and/or testing processes.
Our Story
CSGempowers companies to build unforgettable experiences, making it easier for people and businesses to connect with, use and pay for the services they value most. For over 40 years, CSG's technologies and people have helped some of the world's most recognizable brands solve their toughest business challenges and evolve to meet the demands of today's digital economy.
By channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experiences extraordinary. Our people [CSGers] are fearlessly committed and connected, high on integrity and low on ego, making us the easiest company to do business with and the best place to work. We power a culture of integrity, innovation, and impact across ourlocations, representing the most authentic version of ourselves to build a better future together. That's just who we are.Learn more about CSG Inclusion & Impact here

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About The YellowIpe
Our mission is to inspire the connection between technology and people, we foster the best of our professionals through our expertise in finding and attracting the best talent for the best projects. The Focus on People, Collaboration and Commitment are the pillars that guide us in this trajectory.
Join the yellow team as our new Machine Learning Engineer!
Required Competencies:
- Strong knowledge of Operations Research (OR) and Mathematical Optimization techniques.
- Experience with Mixed-Integer Linear Programming (MILP) and constraint-based optimization.
- Practical experience with solvers and tools, both open-source and commercial, such as OR-Tools, Gurobi, CPLEX, or Pyomo.
- Advanced proficiency in Python programming, with a focus on writing efficient and production-ready code.
- Experience in handling large-scale computations efficiently in distributed systems or the cloud.
Nice to have:
- Knowledge of stochastic optimization and heuristic/metaheuristic approaches (Simulated Annealing, Genetic Algorithms).
- Exposure to machine learning for demand forecasting.
- Experience in building and deploying microservices in a production environment.
- Experience with REST APIs, message-driven architectures (Azure Service Bus, RabbitMQ, or Kafka).
- Knowledge of PostgreSQL or other relational databases.
- Experience with Docker & Kubernetes for containerized deployments.
- Understanding of failure handling & retries in asynchronous systems.
Responsibilities:
- Implement a comprehensive mathematical model that captures all constraints and optimization goals.
- Select and justify the best optimization solver based on performance, cost, and business needs.
- Deliver a fully functional solver.
- Provide performance benchmarks and ensure that the solver can handle real-world complexity.
Importante informations:
- Please note that this is a part-time job. In the consulting area, you would work approximatelly 10 hours per month, and on the implementation part, you would work up to full-time. This project will last between 1-3 months.
Apply for this opportunity in ourwebsite! =)

title: Senior Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
Critical Manufacturing is dedicated to empowering high-performance operations to make Industry 4.0 a reality with the most innovative, comprehensive, and modular MES software. We have a global presence, but our headquarters, and the main technical center, are in Porto (Maia), Portugal, where we develop a state-of-the-art solution for Semiconductor, Electronics, Medical Devices, and other Discrete industries.
Recognized as a Leader by Gartner, we are part of ASMPT, the world's largest supplier of best-in-class equipment, and technological process partner for the electronics and semiconductor industries.
The role:In order to ensure our high-quality requirements while shortening development times, we are looking for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer to implement automatic test processes for complex multi-client systems. You ensure to deliver high quality solutions to our internal Partner ASMPT in Germany. You play a significant role in the implementation of highly complex automatic test processes that are used for regression and acceptance tests for validation. If you think you’re a good fit for this role, team up and apply now!
What you will do:
- Analysis and design of test requirements in the area of material management
- Design and perform user acceptance application testing considering functionality, performance and usability
- Creating test environments (Release Pipeline, Virtualization, Cloud, Container)
- Implementation of test sequences for automated software tests
- Carrying out the manual and automatic tests
- Reporting test status and test results
- Support the development team during the development process
- Support the product management team for all matters related with validation and software quality
- Review and contribute to product documentation

What you must have:
- More than 5 years of professional experience in testing complex software solutions
- Experience writing and executing test plans and test scripts
- Experience with software lifecycle and source control tools (preferably Git and Azure DevOps)
- Knowledge of tools for test automation (preferably Selenium and Grafana K6)
- Knowledge of  SQL Server databases (write queries)
- Knowledge of programming language (preferably C#/.NET) and scripting language (PowerShell)
- Knowledge in virtualization, cloud and container technologies
- Knowledge of the agile testing process
- Willingness to travel internationally

title: Risk Manager
description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:
Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports

What will you be doing?
- Cybersecurity Risk Management – Identify, assess, and mitigate cybersecurity risks.
- IT Risk Management – Evaluate and manage technology-related and regulatory risks.
- IT Audits – Conduct information security and compliance audits.
- Data Protection – Ensure GDPR compliance and manage information security (DPO role).
- Business Continuity (BCP) – Manage plans to ensure business continuity and minimize risk.
- Problem Solving – Analyze issues and propose practical solutions.
- Project Coordination – Support project planning and follow-up on remediation actions.
- Supplier Certification – Evaluate and certify third-party vendors.
- Communication – Collaborate with internal teams and external providers.

What are we looking for?
- 3 to 5 years of experience in at least one of the following: Cybersecurity, IT Risk Management, IT Audit, Data Protection (DPO), Business Continuity (BCP).
- Degree in Computer Engineering, Management, Information Security, or related fields.
- Security Standards & Certifications:ISO 27001, ISO 22301, NIST CSF, COBIT, SOC 2
- Security Methodologies:OWASP, OSSTMM, Vulnerability Management
- Risk & Compliance:IT Audit, Risk Assessment, Regulatory Compliance
- Fluent inPortugueseandEnglish
- Spanish(even basic) is a strong advantage
- Citizenship or Work permit in Portugal (mandatory).

What do we have to offer you?
- Health Insurance;
- Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
- A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs.  You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
- Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?
- Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
- Reference prizes and birthday present;
- Lounge;
- We don’t have a dress code;
- We know your name and all address each other informally;
- Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
- You will grow in good company.  Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?
We are waiting for you at<endereço ocultado>
Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;
Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for one year period).
The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.
For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL’s headquarters in Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa or use the DPO’s e-mail -<endereço ocultado>. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority –<endereço ocultado>.
(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to o criminal convictions and offences.)

description:
ADellenté uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.

Como é Ser Cloud Operations Specialist?
- Com foco principal na administração e manutenção de serviços de infraestrutura em cloud (Azure e AWS);- Capacidade e competências de administração e manutenção de serviços on-premisse (linux, web services, monitorização e automação).
O que valorizamos:

O que oferecemos?

title: Fullstack Developer (Node.JS/React.JS)
description:
Hey Data Lover!Are you ready to embark on this exciting adventure?
With us, you will be able to enhance all your analytical, technological, and business skills and capabilities.
It's time to take off into the future through the power of data! Join us and get ready to break the rules and reach your best version.
Discover the power of SDG: global leaders in the data industry.

At SDG we work for half of the IBEX-35 companies, but also for a multitude of international companies. Thanks to the analytics boom, we are at aconstant pace of growth, and since 1994 we have become thetrusted partnerfor companies that want to maximize the full potential of their data.

What will be your mission?
- You will participate in the development of solutions and projects in the field of data engineering inBIandBig Data.
- Our Software Factory oversees the creation of customized solutions for our clients. You will provide both our clients and teams with all the technical knowledge they need when it comes tosoftware engineeringtopics.
- You will developweb sites,extensions,integrationswith data visualizations tools. You will work with technologies from the BI and Big Data world, in a cloud environment.
- You will work hand-in-hand with Project Managers, Frontend and Backend developers, and Architects to deliver high-quality results and manage client expectations, timelines, and resources.
- You will collaborate with other developers to create solutions, working in anAgileenvironment to quickly prototype new products and test new technologies.

What will make you successful in this position?
- Computer Engineering,Telecommunicationsor other academic output that has endowed you with the capacity for development and critical thinking in this environment.
- You will have a great deal of responsibility, so we require at least4 years of experience﻿as a Fullstack Developer.
- We require good knowledge ofFrontend Developmentbased onReact.js, preferably with knowledge of software system design and architecture concepts. We later prepare the final visualization of our client's data on their website.
- You will be part of a Full-Stack team, so you also need to have solid knowledge of Backend technologies (specifically,Node.js).
- You will deal directly with external clients, so we want to see great communication and interrelationship skills.
- Experience with management tools (Jira, Confluence). We work in an Agile setting, so we seek maximum automation of our processes.
- As we work in a global environment, you must be able to communicate in English!

What makes us different?
In our projects, data and technology are the protagonists, we will train you so that you can work with the latest on the market (we have an innovation area where we promote new partnerships with technological manufacturers and R&D centers).
You will haveevery opportunity to reach your best version, with a completelypersonalized career planin which you will learn by yourself and have the support of your other colleagues.
You will set your own pace! You will speak with your Managerevery six monthsto sharefeedbackandestablish new goals, and, based on your results, there will be asalary review.
We are abig community, from day 1 we will try to make your life easier. Both your colleagues and the rest of the team will always be willing to help you and offer you all their support.
You will collaborate and work on a daily basis withgreat references(technical and/or business), they will be happy to teach you everything possible and will be proud to see you grow.
With usSmartworkis possible. You will experience a way of working in which everyone manages their own time.
We are a brand with purpose. We believe thatdiversityandinclusionhelp promote a culture of creativity, allowing us to overcome new situations and challenges.

JOIN NOW, WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!
Visit ourCareer Siteand apply:Fullstack Developer (Node/React) - SDG Group

title: Security Architect
description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:
Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports

What you will be doing?
- Analyze network and infrastructure architecture.
- Be responsible for evaluating network and infrastructure architecture, aiming to contribute to continuous improvement with a focus on resilience and security.

What you need to have?
- Solid experience with network and firewall administration (Cisco, Juniper, CheckPoint, PaloAlto, Fortinet).
- Knowledge of Public and Private Cloud infrastructure, including Routing, NACLs, Security Groups, and Direct Connect/Express Route or equivalents.
- Certification or equivalent knowledge: CCNA, CCNP.
- Strong knowledge of Routing & Switching (static and dynamic routing, OSPF, BGP, VRRP, etc.).
- Knowledge of network architecture and implementation.
- Familiarity with access and zero trust technologies.
- Experience with protection against DoS and DDoS attacks.
- Knowledge of WAFs and their use cases.
- Experience with Cisco ACI and Catalyst Center.
- Passion for staying up to date with the latest trends in security, new ideas, and innovative solutions.
- Proactivity and problem-solving mindset.
- Strong communication skills.

What do we have to offer you?
- Health Insurance;
- Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
- A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs.  You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
- Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?
- Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
- Reference prizes and birthday present;
- Lounge;
- We don’t have a dress code;
- We know your name and all address each other informally;
- Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
- You will grow in good company.  Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?
We are waiting for you at<endereço ocultado>

title: IT Engineer - Technical Lead
DWH Developer
description:
EMPRESA
A Viação Alvorada, empresa de transportes com cerca de 1.000 colaboradores, integrada num dos projetos de mobilidade urbana mais atrativos tecnologicamente em Portugal, está neste momento a recrutar umDesenvolvedor DWHpara a nossa sede emQueluz.
O candidato selecionado reportará aoDepartamento de Gestão de Sistemas Informáticos, assumindo as seguintes responsabilidades.

DETALHES
ODBA SQL HíbridoeDesenvolvedor de Data Warehouseserá responsável pelo design, implementação, manutenção e otimização de bancos de dados SQL Server para garantir a disponibilidade, confiabilidade e desempenho de aplicativos de negócios críticos.
Terá um papel fundamental no projeto, construção e manutenção de soluções escaláveis ​​dedata warehouseque suportam BI e análises.

COMPETÊNCIAS
- Monitorizar ambientesSQL Server, analisando problemas de desempenho, ameaças à segurança e possíveis falhas.
- Responder a alertas e incidentes, solucionar problemas e implementar resoluções.
- Executar tarefas de manutenção de rotina, comobackupsde bancos de dados, manutenção de índices e atualizações de estatísticas.
- Otimizar o desempenho doSQL Serveranalisando planos de execução de consultas e ajustando configurações de banco de dados.
- Verificar e aplicar políticas de segurança e controles de acesso para proteger dados confidenciais.
- Monitorizar o espaço em disco, o uso da memória e a utilização daCPUpara garantir a alocação ideal de recursos.
- Elaborar configurações de banco de dados, procedimentos de manutenção e etapas de solução de problemas.
- Desenvolver e testarscriptspara automatizar tarefas de administração de banco de dados e melhorar a eficiência operacional.
- Colaborar com equipes de desenvolvimento para otimizar esquemas de banco de dados, consultas e desempenho de aplicativos.
- Manter-se informado sobre atualizações, práticas recomendadas e tendências do setor doSQL Server.
- Projetar, desenvolver e manter estruturas dedata warehouse, incluindo esquemasstaresnowflake, otimizados para desempenho e escalabilidade.
- Desenvolver e gerenciar processosETLusando ferramentas para extrair, transformar e carregar dados de diversas fontes.
- Monitorizar e otimizar o desempenho do banco de dados, incluindo ajuste de consultas e estratégias de indexação.
- Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com desenvolvedores de BI, analistas e partes interessadas de negócios para compreender as necessidades de relatórios e garantir que odata warehousedê suporte a esses objetivos.
- Investigar e solucionar problemas nodata warehousee nos processos deETL.

REQUISITOS
- Mais de 3 anos de experiência trabalhando como desenvolvedor DWH ou DBA.
- Forte proficiência em SQL e sistemas de gerenciamento de banco de dados.
- Experiência prática com ferramentas ETL.
- Familiaridade com ferramentas de BI.
- Sólido conhecimento de técnicas de modelagem de dados, incluindo modelagem dimensional e normalização.

A NOSSA OFERTA
- Excelente oportunidade de ingressar numa empresa líder no sector.
- Treinamento e monitoramento contínuo.
- Bom ambiente de trabalho e desenvolvimento profissional.
- Salário de acordo com experiência comprovada.
- Vale-refeição em cartão.
- Plano de saúde.
- Bilhete de transporte.

Envie-nos a sua candidatura para<endereço ocultado>com a indicação deDWH Developer.

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

Neotalent, the responsive people.

Role Overview:
We are looking for aFinancial Consultantto integrate our teams in into one of the largest insurance groups in the world, present in 64 countries. It’s an opportunity hybrid.

You will be responsible for analyzing financial information, maintaining accurate records, assisting in routine accounting activities, and promptly addressing inquiries from internal and external stakeholders. description:
Estamos à procura de um(a) Técnico(a) Administrador(a) de Sistemas e Networking para reforçar a nossa equipa. Se és apaixonado(a) por infraestrutura, segurança, redes e garantias de performance e disponibilidade dos sistemas, então queremos conhecer-te!
Responsabilidades:
- Gerir, monitorizar e otimizar servidores físicos e virtuais (Linux e/ou Windows);- Administrar redes internas e externas, firewalls, switches, VPNs e outros equipamentos de rede;- Garantir a segurança e a integridade dos dados e sistemas;- Realizar backups, atualizações e manutenção preventiva dos sistemas;- Diagnosticar e resolver problemas técnicos de forma proativa;- Colaborar com equipas de desenvolvimento e suporte para garantir estabilidade e performance dos serviços;- Documentar procedimentos, topologias e intervenções técnicas.
Requisitos:
- Formação superior em Engenharia Informática, Redes, Sistemas ou área semelhante;- Experiência comprovada em administração de sistemas (Linux/Windows Server);- Bons conhecimentos em protocolos de rede (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, etc.);- Experiência com serviços de virtualização (VMware, Hyper-V, etc.);- Familiaridade com ferramentas de monitorização e scripts (PowerShell, Bash, etc.);- Noções de cibersegurança e boas práticas de hardening;- Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autónoma e em equipa;- Boa comunicação e sentido de responsabilidade.
Valorizamos:
- Certificações como CompTIA Network+, Windows server, CCNA, MCSA, etc.;- Experiência com cloud (AWS, Azure, etc.);- Conhecimentos em ambientes híbridos (on-prem + cloud);- Fluência em inglês técnico.

title: Incident Manager
description:
Who are we:
Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.
We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.
With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.
Neotalent, the responsive people.
Find out more about us at<endereço ocultado>.
Role Overview:
Neotalent is looking for anIncident Managerwith experience to join one of the largest insurance groups in the world, present in 64 countries – offices in Lisbon (hybrid).
What you will do:
You will integrate an international team: Major Incident Management for platforms, infrastructure, datacenters and centralized services consumed by the entities in the EU market.
- You will support the current team in the coordination of major incidents. In anticipation of organizational changes additional expertise capacity in the team is required.
- Coordinating cross-functional teams to resolve MI's within established SLA's.
- Problem management activities can be required (problem record coordination, RCA communication);
What you are like:
- At least 3 years of experience as a Incident Manager;
- Expertise on Major Incident Management, using standard SM tools (preferably ServiceNow);
- Experience coordinating cross-functional teams to resolve tickets within established SLA's.
- ITIL;
- Good written and verbal communication skills in English.
Why join us
- Work on challenging projects for big clients
- Learn more about emerging technologies
- Possibility of working remotely
- Design your career plan
- Access to continuous training and certifications
- Evolve through our internal mobility program
- … and much more!
To apply:
Please send your CV to<endereço ocultado>withMVT_ IMin the email subject.

- 6+ years of experience in SAP Fiori, and SAPUI5 development, included frontend and backend components;- Experience in design, and develop custom SAP Fiori applications using SAP Fiori UI5, SAP Web IDE, SAP BAS, and SAP Fiori Design Guidelines;- Experience with Fiori and Extend Standard Fiori Apps, Ui5, OData, S4/Hana, and CDS Views;- Experience with integrate Fiori apps with SAP backend systems: S/4HANA using OData services, JSON, and other RESTful APIs;- Able to develop Fiori Launchpad configurations, tiles, and catalogs to optimize the Fiori user experience;- Strong understanding of systems develop lifecycle and system implementation methods;- Proficient in Business Analysis, Business Kwledge, Testing, Architecture Kwledge, and Technical Solution Design;- Able to write custom ABAP code to support Fiori applications as enhancements, function modules, and data retrieval via OData services;- Having SAP Certification will be a plus;- Fluent in English and Portuguese.

title: Clear Data Protection & Privacy Senior Consultant
description:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.
Would you like to make an impact in different industries with your work? Then this project is for you. Here you will have the opportunity to be part of a multicultural and inclusive team with global projection that contacts with areas such as consultancy, law, strategy, insurance, finance, among others.
We are looking for an experiencedClear Data Protection & Privacy Senior Consultantfor a long term role in this project inLisbonorPorto(hybrid).
Skills and attributes for success:
- Ability to relate well with others, build relationships and constructively interact with a variety of people and situations, including fostering relationships with client personnel;- Consistently deliver quality client services. Monitor progress, manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes;- Analytical ability to define problems, collect data, establish and organize facts, draw valid conclusions, and develop effective solutions.Desire to innovate in an everchanging regulatory landscape;- Motivated to achieve professional goals and demonstrate flexibility to complete more challenging tasks;- Self-motivated, able to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment;- Able to clearly communicate solutions to problems in an effective manner;- Proactive, flexible, responsive, and resourceful;- Excellent ability to organize and prioritize multiple tasks;- An interest in the privacy and data issues arising from various technology driven industries, including social media;- Skilled at maximizing risk mitigation while minimizing the impact to the business.
To qualify for the role, the candidate must have:- You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world;- You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world;- You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust;- Qualifications:- Degree in a related field and 2-5 years of related work experience;- Experience at this level in industry or consultancy experience in the Portuguese market;- Knowledge and understanding of the core data privacy principles and data/information lifecycle (e.g., notice, consent, data collection, data use, retention, disposal, security for privacy, disclosures to third parties, data integrity, and monitoring);- Understanding of legal and regulatory requirements and compliance issues affecting clients related to privacy and data protection;- Track record in supporting the delivery of significant Data Privacy and Data Protection programs.
Ideally, you’ll also have
- Professional Certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), or similar credentials in data protection and privacy;- Demonstrated experience or knowledge in the following areas:- Privacy and data governance;- Privacy policy creation or review;- Consumer/Data Subject Rights;- Privacy by Design concepts;- Privacy, protection, and information governance data discovery tools (e.g., BigID, OneTrust);- Proficiency in using Microsoft Office applications, especially Visio, PowerPoint, Excel and Word;- Basic understanding of information technology and cybersecurity related issues;- Experience writing business and functional requirements with specifications, including strong documentation skills,- Prior business experience working communicating with project stakeholders and balancing business needs with tailored solutions.
For more informations about this project, please submit your applicationhere.You can also explore our content about the job markethere.

title: Senior IAM Engineer
description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:
Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports

What will you be doing?
- Manage and lead IAM consulting engagements, ensuring delivery on quality, time, and budget.
- Scope, plan, and deliver IAM projects with clients across sectors.
- Design and implement secure IAM architectures and practices (e.g., role-based access, MFA, SSO).
- Actively contribute to business development by identifying opportunities, supporting proposals, and developing go-to-market materials.
- Mentor and guide team members through hands-on leadership.
- Collaborate with alliance partners and integrate IAM solutions within broader IT strategies.
- Produce thought leadership and internal knowledge assets on IAM trends and offerings.

What are we looking for?
- 4+ years in Consulting or Technology, especially with IAM or cybersecurity.
- 3+ years hands-on experiencein one or more of the following:
- Identity lifecycle management & governance
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- SSO, MFA, Federation (e.g., Azure AD)
- SailPoint, CyberArk (preferred), Okta, Ping, Saviynt, One Identity, Micro Focus
- Privileged Access Management (PAM)
- Directory services (e.g., Active Directory, Azure AD)
- Security in cloud-based environments (especially MS O365 deployments)
- IAM support in M&A projects (domain migrations, consolidations)
- Certifications are a plus:
- Microsoft Certified (Identity & Cybersecurity)
- CISSP,CIAM,CIMP,CAMS, etc.
- Agile/Scrum certificationsalso considered an asset
- GoodEnglishandPortuguese(min B2);
- Citizenship or Work permit in Portugal (mandatory).

What do we have to offer you?
- Health Insurance;
- Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
- A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs.  You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
- Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?
- Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
- Reference prizes and birthday present;
- Lounge;
- We don’t have a dress code;
- We know your name and all address each other informally;
- Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
- You will grow in good company.  Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?
We are waiting for you at<endereço ocultado>
Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;
Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for one year period).
The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.
For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL’s headquarters in Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa or use the DPO’s e-mail -<endereço ocultado>. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority –<endereço ocultado>.
(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to o criminal convictions and offences.)

description:
Optimizer has been a trusted partner in the IT industry for over 25 years, delivering value through technology. We build, or help our customers build, top-notch digital solutions that drive sustainable business growth. Our strong brand is synonymous with high quality, trust, and long-term relationships, with many clients staying with us for over 20 years.
Our team of more than 90 professionals serves customers across multiple industries, leveraging the best technologies available in the market. We offer diverse business models, including consulting, projects, and application managed services, as well as building dedicated teams to support our customers' product development needs. At Optimizer, we focus on making digital innovation work effectively for our clients.
What are we looking for?
As a Backend Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining server-side logic, ensuring seamless integration with frontend applications and optimised database performance. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable and efficient backend systems, create APIs, and solve complex technical challenges. This role is ideal for someone passionate about creating robust, high-performing backend solutions to support modern applications.
– Experience in backend development, with expertise in building robust and scalable applications.– Technical Skills: Proficiency in backend technologies like Node.js, Python, or Java, and experience integrating with modern frontend frameworks such as React.– Database Expertise: Strong knowledge of relational and/or NoSQL databases, including performance optimisation.– API Development: Proven experience in designing and implementing RESTful or GraphQL APIs.– Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills to debug, optimise, and enhance backend systems.– Proactive Approach: A self-driven professional with a focus on delivering high-quality results.– Soft Skills: Excellent organisational and communication abilities to collaborate within a team.– Language Proficiency: A good command of English is mandatory.– Educational Background: A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

What we can offer:
At Optimizer, we prioritise your well-being and growth with a benefits package that includes:
– Home Office Flexibility– Health Insurance– Up to 25 Days of Annual Vacation– Meal Allowance– Laptop, Mobile Phone, and Data Plan– Employee Referral Rewards– Exclusive Partnerships– Learning & Development Programmes– Career Growth Opportunities– Gym Membership or Sports Subscription– Annual Performance Bonus

Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Company Overview
team.blue is an ecosystem of successful brands working together across regions to provide customers with everything they need to succeed online. 60+ successful brands make up the group; with a team of 2.700 experts serving its 3.3 million customers across Europe and beyond.
team.blue's brands are a mix of traditional hosting businesses, offering services from domain names, email, shared hosting, e-commerce and server hosting solutions and specialist SaaS providers offering adjacent products such as compliance, marketing tools and team collaboration products. This broad product offering makes it a one-stop partner for online businesses and entrepreneurs across Europe.
Position Overview
We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our Solution Architects team. This is not a standard DevOps role – it requires a hybrid profile that blends infrastructure automation, deep troubleshooting, and direct customer solution support. The selected candidate will work on optimizing and maintaining our infrastructure while also deploying and supporting customer solutions.

The candidate will be responsible for:
- Managing and optimizing cloud and on-premises infrastructure
- Automating deployments and infrastructure maintenance using Puppet and Ansible
- Troubleshooting infrastructure and application issues, working directly and indirectly with customers
- Ensuring high availability and performance of services
- Monitoring with Prometheus, Grafana, CheckMk/Zabbix
- Working with virtualization technologies such as KVM
- Deploying and managing web services using Nginx, Apache, and PHP-FPM
- Optimizing and managing MySQL and PostgreSQL databases

Required Skills & Technologies
- Strong experience in Linux systems administration
- Expertise in automation tools (Ansible, Puppet)
- Hands-on experience with monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, CheckMk, Zabbix)
- Experience with CI/CD pipelines using GitLab CI
- Strong understanding of load balancing and caching (NGINX/HAProxy)
- Knowledge of web services and application hosting (Nginx, Apache, PHP-FPM)
- Experience with virtualization (KVM)
- Proficiency in working with MySQL and PostgreSQL databases
- Experience with backup systems such as R1Soft, Acronis, and Veeam

Nice to Have
- Security and performance tuning experience for web and database services
- Strong troubleshooting skills and experience working in high-availability environments
- Experience with public cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
- Open-source contributions or published projects

APPLICATIONS:<endereço ocultado>

title: C++ Developer
Cloud Data Engineer
description:
Who are we:
Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.
We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.
With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.
Neotalent, the responsive people.
Find out more about us at<endereço ocultado>.
Role Overview:
We are looking for aCloud Data Engineerto join one of our biggest clients in the Lisbon area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.
What you will do:
- Ensuring the management of applications and data in the cloud;
- Serverless Infrastructure: Collaborate in the design, development and serverless optimization of AWS for data pipelines;
- Adjust components for performance, scalability, security and data privacy.
- Smart Device Integration: Integrate smart devices using AWS IoT Core with secure protocols;
- Troubleshoot and ensure seamless device connectivity.
- External Data Integration: Extract, standardize and enrich data from external partners via APIs; Ensure robust error handling and data validation.
- Database Management: Administer SQL and NoSQL databases, ensuring configuration and optimization; Implement data retention, backups and collaborate with analysts.
- Data Pipeline Design: Design end-to-end data pipelines with quality checks and monitoring; Enhance pipelines to meet changing business needs.
- Data Lake Management: Architect scalable data lakes with partitioning, indexing and access controls; Maintain data lake integrity with data architects.
What you are like:
- At least 3 years of work experience as a Data Engineer;
- Advanced programming skills in Python;;
- Experience in implementing AWS technologies;
- Experience in data engineering (e.g. AWS Glue, Amazon Athena, DBT, Spark);
- Experience in SQL databases (e.g. Amazon RDS and Amazon Aurora) and noSQL (e.g. Amazon DynamoDB);
- Proven experience in Agile Scrum and/or Kanban projects.
Why join us
- Work on challenging projects for big clients
- Learn more about emerging technologies
- Possibility of working remotely
- Design your career plan
- Access to continuous training and certifications
- Evolve through our internal mobility program
- … and much more!
To apply:
Please send your CV to<endereço ocultado>withMVT_DECin the email subject.

About KWAN
We connect IT professionals with projects that match their skills, professional experience, and goals, then we offer a career progression program, delivered by in-house specialists - our People Experience Partners - to guide them through our journey with us.

What is this challenge about
- Be part of the Outbound Campaigns Team, focused on building the next generation enterprise campaigns management features in the public multi-cloud and hybrid-cloud solutions.

Some Words From Our Colleagues

description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!
@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it,  and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

The amazing you, will have:

- Proven experience with Murex MX.3

Advantages:

- We are looking for an experienced Murex Developer with strong knowledge of MX.3 to join our international team in Portugal.

- You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
- Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity

- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you

- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!
We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.
All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

title: IAM - Identity Access Management Consultant
description:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.
Would you like to make an impact in different industries with your work? Then this project is for you. Here you will have the opportunity to be part of a multicultural and inclusive team with global projection that contacts with areas such as consultancy, law, strategy, insurance, finance, among others.
We are looking forIdentity Access Management Senior Consultantfor our team.
Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
- Managing a portfolio of IAM engagements with our clients, responsible for leading engagements including meeting quality, time and budget targets;- Working with prospective clients to agree, scope and plan the delivery phase of engagements;- Drive developing the market for IAM across all sectors, identifying sales opportunities and working with senior practice leaders and market leaders in the creation of proposals and marketing material;- Leading and developing team members by sharing knowledge, acting as mentor and coach to them and leading by example- Creating thought leadership and market materials for selling and promoting Cyber and IAM Security offerings.
Skills and Attributes For Success:- Be professional, quickly establishing personal credibility and demonstrating expertise;- Be a good communicator with the ability to contribute assuredly to IAM business and technical security discussions with peers;- Be a team player who is not only looking to enhance their own career but recognises the value of teamwork, facilitating and encouraging collaboration amongst team members, and is capable of motivating teams to maximise performance;- Take a practical approach to solving issues and gaining client agreement;- Be able to analyse complex problems and to deliver insightful, practical and sustainable;- Be confident and effective in recognising and managing potential issues during client assignments;- Structure and manage projects which meet client expectations and mitigate any risks or issues.To qualify for the role you must have:
- Exposure across one or more of the following IAM areas: Identity Governance; Access Management; Privileged Access; Management; Consumer Identity; OT IAM;- Experience with one or more of the following IAM technologies: SailPoint; Saviynt, CyberArk; Azure AD; OneIdentity, BeyondTrust, Okta; Ping, ForgeRock;- IAM business analysis experience; requirements gathering and use case development;- IAM assessment, strategy and roadmap development;- IAM controls governance frameworks over processes, controls, organisation and infrastructure;- Experience managing and coaching others in the development and delivery of complex client solutions and/or IAM proposition development;- Design experience for IAM solutions on client transformations.
Ideally, you’ll also have:- Identity Management Institute (IMI) certifications, such as: Certified Identity and Access Manager (CIAM), Certified Access; Management Specialist (CAMS), Certified Access Management Professional (CIMP), Certified Identity Governance Expert (CIGE);- Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) and Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) certifications;- Key sector experience in one or more of the following: Government & Public sector / Energy & Utilities / Retail and Consumer products / Life sciences / Telecoms, Media and Technology / Transport;- Project management experience on IAM solution deployments (waterfall and/or agile);- Proven track record of business development;- Professional services experience working as a consultant with market leading organisations in the delivery of their IAM solutions.
What we are looking for:- Advanced data and evidence management, client management on remediation programmes, driving innovation and continuous improvement;- Strong technical insight, practical knowledge and specialist capability;- Demonstrable market/sector expertise in your field;- Versatility;- Proven ability to adapt and learn in an innovative environment.
ApplyIf the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate toapply here.You can also explore our content about the job markethere.

title: .Net developer
description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!
@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it,  and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.
At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!
We are looking for an Amazing:.Net developer
Seniority:Mid (3-5 years)
Type of position:Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!
The amazing you, will have:
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
- Proven experience as a .NET Developer (+4 years).
- Familiarity with SQL Server or other relational databases.
- Familiarity with Entity Framework, LINQ, and microservices architecture.
- Experience with RESTful API development and integration.
- Experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure or AWS.
- Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).
- Good problem-solving and communication skills.
- Knowledge of DevOps tools and CI/CD pipelines.
- English level C1.
To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):
- Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like Angular or React is a plus.
Why should you become part of our family?
- You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
- Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
- Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
- International projects in Benelux:you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
- Type of projects(depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for youFull Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your homeFull Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
- Full Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
- Take care of your well-being:Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote
- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
- Full Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Who are we?
Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!
We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.
All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

title: Technical Project Manager / Engineering Manager
description:
TechRivo is a software consulting company based in Portugal but working with several European Companies.
We have Customers in Europe and Australia in projects ranging from Fintech to Education.
We are looking for a highly skilled and experiencedTechnical Project Manager / Engineering Managerwith a strong background in software development and project leadership, particularly in Java-based technologies.
We are looking to build a long-term collaboration with someone passionate about technology and delivering successful outcomes.
Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with a strong technical foundation who thrives in dynamic project environments. You should have the ability to balance technical depth with management responsibilities and be committed to driving projects to success while maintaining a collaborative atmosphere.
If you are looking for a flexible, impactful role with the opportunity to work on innovative projects while collaborating with a motivated team, we would love to hear from you!
Key Responsibilities
- Project Leadership:Manage IT projects end-to-end, ensuring timely delivery, quality, and adherence to client requirements
- System Design & Architecture:Collaborate with engineering teams to discuss, design, and validate system ideas and architectures, critically evaluating potential solutions
- Team Management:Lead small to medium engineering teams, mentoring developers, resolving challenges, and fostering a collaborative environment
- Client Communication:Act as the primary point of contact for customers, providing regular project updates, addressing concerns, and managing expectations
- Code & PR Reviews:Review code pull requests for quality and adherence to best practices (hands-on coding not mandatory but occasionally needed)
- Strategic Collaboration:Work closely with the CTO to align project execution with broader organizational strategies and goals
- DevOps Understanding:Assess and advise on DevOps strategies to ensure seamless deployment pipelines and system stability
- Reporting:Prepare and deliver detailed project status reports to both internal stakeholders and clients
- Adaptability:Quickly learn and understand new technologies and frameworks when required, especially to guide teams effectively
Qualifications
Technical Expertise:
- Strong background in Java and associated technologies
- Solid understanding of software architecture principles
- Experience with DevOps concepts (e.g., CI/CD pipelines, containerization, infrastructure as code)
Leadership Skills:Proven ability to manage and mentor engineering teams, ensuring alignment and quality outcomes
Project Management:
- Hands-on experience in managing IT projects of varying sizes
- Familiarity with agile methodologies, Kanban, or Scrum frameworks
Problem-Solving:Demonstrated ability to think critically, assess technical challenges, and propose effective solutions
Communication:Exceptional written and verbal communication skills for client interaction and team collaboration
AI Experience (Bonus):Familiarity with AI/ML concepts and applications is a plus
Other/Soft Skills:
- English language proficiency
- Team Player
- Keen on doing video calls and tracking your work
- Comfortable doing a Technical Assessment Test
Send us your application:<endereço ocultado>
Please note that applications made through other channels, will not be considered.

title: .Net developer
description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!
@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it,  and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.
At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!
We are looking for an Amazing:.Net developer
Seniority:Mid (3-5 years)
Type of position:Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!
The amazing you, will have:
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
- Proven experience as a .NET Developer (+4 years).
- Familiarity with SQL Server or other relational databases.
- Familiarity with Entity Framework, LINQ, and microservices architecture.
- Experience with RESTful API development and integration.
- Experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure or AWS.
- Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).
- Good problem-solving and communication skills.
- Knowledge of DevOps tools and CI/CD pipelines.
- English level C1.
To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):
- Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like Angular or React is a plus.
- You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
- Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
- Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
- International projects in Benelux:you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
- Type of projects(depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for youFull Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your homeFull Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
- Full Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
- Take care of your well-being:Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote
- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
- Full Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Who are we?
Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!
We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.
All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

title: Analista de Vulnerabilidades
description:
ADellenté uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.
A área das telecomunicações está em constante evolução. Se também gostarias de fazer parte deste movimento, este projeto poderá ser do teu interesse, já que aqui terás a possibilidade de contactar com um dos líderes na criação e distribuição de soluções fixas e móveis de televisão, internet, voz e dados a nível nacional.
Procuramos um(a)Analista de Vulnerabilidadespara integrar a nossa equipa neste projeto de longo prazo emLisboa ou Porto (modelo híbrido).
O que esperamos de ti:
- Realizar avaliações de vulnerabilidades em sistemas, redes e aplicações para identificar possíveis fraquezas de segurança;- Analisar e interpretar os resultados de scans de vulnerabilidades para determinar a gravidade e o impacto potencial das - vulnerabilidades identificadas;- Validar se as vulnerabilidades são efetivamente exploráveis, comprovando sempre que necessário através da exploração das mesmas;- Priorizar as vulnerabilidades com base na sua gravidade e impacto potencial nas operações, ativos e informação da organização;- Garantir com as áreas intervenientes que existem planos de remediação para abordar as vulnerabilidades identificadas;- Esclarecer equipas intervenientes no processo de forma a garantir a resolução oportuna e eficaz das vulnerabilidades;- Manter-se atualizado com as últimas ameaças de segurança e tendências de vulnerabilidade para identificar e mitigar proativamente os riscos potenciais;- Documentar vulnerabilidades e atividades de remediação para manter um registo preciso e abrangente da postura de segurança da organização.O que procuramos:
- Formação Académica Superior em Engenharia Informática, Eletrotécnica ou experiência equivalente;- Experiência mínima de 5 anos na área de Cibersegurança de preferência em funções equivalentes;- Capacidade de exploração de vulnerabilidades;- Capacidade de identificação e gestão de riscos;- Capacidade de comunicação e relacionamento interpessoal;- Responsabilidade, proatividade, autonomia e dinamismo;- Pensamento crítico e orientado a resultados;- Capacidade de liderança e trabalho em equipa.
O que oferecemos:
- Seguro de Saúde;- Plano de formação ajustado e personalizado, com um orçamento para gastares nas formações e livros técnicos que considerares necessários;- Feedback constante e acompanhamento para que possas crescer profissionalmente;- Processo de onboarding remoto;- Eventos de equipa todos os semestres para que possas viver novas aventuras;- Descontos e ofertas exclusivas nos nossos parceiros;- Cultura de proximidade e transparência. As tuas ideias e necessidades são ouvidas e valorizadas por nós!
Submete a tua candidatura onlineaqui.
