title: Java Developer
description:
Estamos a reforçar a equipa de R&D, em Lisboa - Seixal, com o seguinte perfil: Java Developer
O Grupo Petrotec é composto por diversas empresas privadas focadas na produção, comercialização, distribuição e suporte técnico de equipamentos e sistemas de gestão para o setor de retalho da indústria petrolífera. Além disso, o Grupo está a inovar em soluções de mobilidade inteligente, oferecendo equipamentos para carregamento de veículos elétricos, serviços e software de gestão.
Aproveitando as suas capacidades de I&D, o grupo presta serviços de Engenharia de Campo e Soluções EPC (chave na mão) para estações de abastecimento de combustíveis ou carregamento de veículos elétricos, bem como para instalações de armazenamento e tubulação.
Com mais de 1200 colaboradores distribuídos por 9 operações diretas (Portugal, Espanha, França, Roménia, Reino Unido, Angola, Moçambique, África do Sul e Índia), o Grupo Petrotec estende o seu alcance a mais de 84 países através de parcerias consolidadas. Isso garante a entrega de soluções técnicas personalizadas e um suporte local eficaz, estabelecendo o Grupo Petrotec como um fornecedor de confiança para os principais clientes internacionais.
Procuramos um Desenvolvedor Backend com paixão pela tecnologia para se juntar à nossa equipa dinâmica. Se tens experiência em Java, és entusiasta de APIs e microserviços e gostas de trabalhar com as tecnologias mais recentes, esta é a oportunidade ideal para ti!
O que irás fazer:
- Desenvolver e desenhar soluções API RESTful, assegurando a sua eficiência e escalabilidade.
- Desenvolver microserviços com arquitetura orientada a eventos, para garantir flexibilidade e desempenho.
- Trabalhar com sistemas de controlo de versão como Git, para garantir uma gestão eficiente do código.
- Implementar testes automatizados com frameworks como JUnit, Mockito ou similares, para garantir a qualidade e fiabilidade do código.
- Automatizar processos de compilação e integração contínua com ferramentas como Maven, Gradle ou semelhantes.
O que esperamos de ti:
- Mais de 2 anos de experiência em desenvolvimento backend, com foco em Java e frameworks como Spring Boot, Micronaut ou Quarkus.
- Sólidos conhecimentos em bases de dados relacionais como MySQL ou PostgreSQL, e experiência em arquitetura de base de dados.
- Experiência prática com metodologias ágeis (SCRUM), integração contínua e ciclos de desenvolvimento ágeis.
- Autonomia, com forte sentido de responsabilidade no desenvolvimento e entrega de soluções de alta qualidade.
- Boa capacidade de comunicação, em português e inglês, para facilitar a colaboração com as equipas.
- Bons conhecimentos de inglês, para interagir com documentação técnica e colaborar em equipas internacionais.
Valorizamos ainda:
- Conhecimentos de programação em Kotlin ou Go, alargando o teu leque de competências.
- Conhecimentos em bases de dados não relacionais como InfluxDB e ElasticSearch, melhorando a análise e procura de dados.
- Experiência com git workflow e em ambientes colaborativos com controlo de versões avançado.
- Conhecimentos em Docker e Kubernetes, essenciais para a otimização e orquestração de ambientes de desenvolvimento e produção.
O que oferecemos:
- Ambiente de trabalho colaborativo e inovador, onde as tuas ideias são valorizadas e a tua contribuição faz a diferença.
- Desafios técnicos em projetos que têm impacto real no mercado e moldam o futuro da tecnologia.
- Oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional contínuo, com acesso a cursos, formações.
- O nosso modelo de trabalho éhíbrido, permitindo um equilíbrio entre trabalho remoto e presencial
Se procuras novos desafios e queres fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza a inovação e o desenvolvimento contínuo, envia o teu currículo agora e junta-te a nós para construir o futuro da tecnologia!

Who We Are
Welcome to Jolera, where traditional managed services transform into extraordinary IT adventures! For over 20 years, we’ve been the backstage tech wizards for MSPs & IT solution providers across the globe, from North America to Europe. We’re not just any company; we are a catalyst for IT magic, creating award-winning solutions that empower businesses worldwide. Our team of seasoned experts brings not just skills but passion to the table, ensuring each partner receives customized, top-tier service. Join us and be part of a team that crafts unique IT experiences for Fortune 500 clientele in the US and Canada.

Who You Are
You are a passionate Project Manager with a knack for 'getting things done.'With your extensive experience in managing IT infrastructure projects, you understand the importance of scope, schedule, and budget yet know when to think outside the box. You’re not just managing projects; you’re leading quests to conquer challenges with creativity and precision, productivity, and efficiency.

What You’ll Do
-Transform high-level scope requirements into actionable project plans.
-Steer projects through its entire lifecycle, ensuring timely, high-quality deliverables.

-Proactively sniff out potential issues and risks, taking charge before they become showstoppers.
-Juggle project dependencies and navigate the critical path with the finesse of a seasoned captain.
-Serve as the chief communicator, crafting updates and presentations that keep everyone, from team members to stakeholders, aware and motivated.
-Drive the team forward, mentoring and inspiring like a coach during playoff season.
-Motivate and influence your teams to be successful in their roles
-Lead a high-performing team, fostering a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

Qualifications:
-A solid educational background in IT or extensive relevant experience.
-At least 5 years experience managing IT infrastructure projects
-A strong understanding of what drives healthy, efficient teams
-Holder of a PMP or PRINCE2 certification
-Skilled in MS Office, MS Project, or similar tools.
-A maestro of virtualization and networking technologies.
-Exceptional ability to translate complex project scopes into victorious project outcomes
-Expert at navigating the complexities of multi-national and multi-disciplinary environments.


What We Offer
-A competitive salary and benefits package that appreciates your worth.
-Perks that make every day a bit more special.
-You will be expected to work from the office three times a week in Porto.
-Opportunities for professional growth and development that will push your career to new heights.
-Join Jolera and be part of a team that values creativity, drive, and a bit of quirkiness, all while delivering serious results. Let’s build the future of IT together, one -successful project at a time.

title: Junior Network Support – Asset Identification Service
description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:
Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.

What are you going to do?
- Play a vital role in identifying, classifying, and maintaining an accurate inventory of network assets across IT and OT environments.

What are we looking for?
- 2–3 years of professional experience in a similar role.
- Foundational experience in network technologies and a proactive attitude towards problem-solving and automation.
- Basic knowledge of networking (Routing, Switching, Network Protocols).
- Experience or familiarity with network devices and tools (Juniper, NetFlow, etc.).
- Proactive mindset with an interest in process improvement and automation.
- Ability to work in a hybrid model and collaborate with international teams.
- Customer service experience is a plus.
- Written and verbal communication skills in English (B2 or above).
- Candidates must be based in Portugal and possess either European citizenship or a valid Work Visa/Residence Card - mandatory requirement.

What do we have to offer you?
- Health Insurance;
- Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
- Working model: hybrid;
- A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs.  You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
- Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?
- Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
- Reference prizes and birthday present;
- We don’t have a dress code;
- We know your name and all address each other informally;
- You will grow in good company.  Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?
We are waiting for you at<endereço ocultado>
Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;
Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for one year period).
The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.
For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL’s headquarters in Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa or use the DPO’s e-mail -<endereço ocultado>. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority –<endereço ocultado>.
(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

title: Network Administrator
Scrum Master
DevOps Engineer
description:
About YellowIpe
Our mission is to inspire the connection between technology and people, we foster the best of our professionals through our expertise in finding and attracting the best talent for the best projects. The Focus on People, Collaboration and Commitment are the pillars that guide us in this trajectory.
Join the yellow team as our new DevOps Engineer!
Responsibilities:Cloud Infrastructure & Automation:
- Manage and optimize Kubernetes clusters (EKS) to ensure high availability and performance.
- Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform for scalable and repeatable deployments.
- Implementation and configuration of HPA (Horizontal Pod Autoscaler) for dynamic scalability.
- Automate deployment and scaling of applications using Helm Charts and YAML manifests.
- Management of namespaces, roles, policies (RBAC), and resource quotas.
CI/CD & Deployment:
- Configure and maintain CI/CD pipelines (AWS CodePipeline, CodeBuild) for rapid integration and testing.
- Manage GitOps workflows with ArgoCD, Rancher, and other automation tools.
- Experience with ECR (Elastic Container Registry) for storage and versioning.
- Implement best practices for continuous integration, testing, and delivery.
Monitoring, Observability & Security:
- Deploy monitoring solutions with Grafana, Prometheus, and Loki for proactive infrastructure and application insights.
- Set up distributed tracing (Jaeger, OpenTelemetry) for debugging and performance analysis.
- Implement cloud security best practices, including IAM policies, Security Groups (SGs), and network ACLs.
- Integrate security scanning tools (Snyk, Trivy) into pipelines to ensure compliance.
Cloud Networking & Database Management:
- Configure and manage AWS networking (VPCs, subnets, ALB/NLB load balancers, gateways).
- Optimize and maintain MongoDB Atlas and Redis for scalable and high-performance data storage.
Collaboration & Continuous Improvement:
- Work closely with development teams to improve deployment processes and reduce lead time.
- Troubleshoot infrastructure issues, optimizing system performance and reliability.
- Stay up to date with emerging DevOps technologies to drive innovation.
Mandatory:
- BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.
- Knowledge and experience in backend development.
- Ability to break down complex problems, making flowcharts and drive towards a solution.
- Expertise in Node.js.
- Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL data stores particularly MongoDB Atlas.
- Experience in developing in a microservices architecture.
- Focus on clean and readable code.
- Ability to work in a team and willingness to work autonomously.
- Complete projects on time.
- Excellent English skills.
What We’re Looking For:
- Proven experience (3+ years) in DevOps and AWS Cloud Infrastructure, or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE).
- Strong expertise in Kubernetes (EKS), Docker, and container orchestration.
- Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible) and automation.
- Hands-on knowledge of CI/CD tools (AWS CodePipeline, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, ArgoCD).
- Proficiency in monitoring and logging solutions (Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, OpenTelemetry).
- Solid understanding of AWS cloud networking (VPC, subnets, ALB/NLB, gateways).
- Experience with cloud security best practices (IAM roles, policies, encryption).
- Knowledge of MongoDB Atlas and Redis for scalable and efficient data handling.
- Scripting and programming skills in NodeJS.
- Familiarity with GitOps principles and tools (ArgoCD, Rancher).
- Fluent in English and Portuguese.
We value:
- Strong understanding of EV charging infrastructure, EV charging and energy management.
- Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
- Excellent capacity: hands-on and results driven.
Important informations:
- Hybrid work model in Porto. 3 days per week in the office.
- Candidates must reside in Portugal.
Apply for this opportunity in ourwebsite! =)

description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:
Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.

What are you going to do?
- Set up and maintain system infrastructure (servers, networks, software).

- Analyze and ensure networks and systems meet project needs.

What are we looking for?
- Experience: 3+ years in a similar role.
- Travel: Available to travel abroad for up to 1 month every 2–3 months.
- Availability: Full-time in-office for first 3 months (training), then hybrid.
- Solid hands-on experience with Linux (RHEL) and Windows environments.
- Experience with system and network setup, troubleshooting, and performance monitoring.
- Familiarity with virtual machines, shell scripting, automation tools (Ansible), and network security tools (VPN, firewalls, IPTables).
- Written and verbal communication skills in English (B2 or above).
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

What do we have to offer you?
- Health Insurance;
- Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
- Working model: hybrid;
- A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs.  You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
- Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?
- Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;

- We know your name and all address each other informally;

As a Business Development Manager at Create IT, you will play a crucial role in expanding our presence in national and international markets. You will identify and develop new business opportunities, build long-term relationships with clients and partners, and collaborate with internal teams to align solutions with client needs. Your strategic insights and market expertise will help shape the future growth of our company.

Key responsibilities

Job qualifications

- Proven experience in business development within the IT services sector, preferably in international contexts.
- Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to build trusting relationships with diverse stakeholders.
- Strong results-oriented mindset, with the ability to identify opportunities and turn them into successful partnerships.
- Knowledge of current technological market trends and adaptability to dynamic environments.

title: Full Stack Engineer (.NET+Angular)
description:
Start your exciting journey with Aubay right here:
Aubay Portugal is a subsidiary of the multinational French company, Aubay Group, present in Portugal since 2007. With offices in Lisbon and Porto, we are a leading provider of consulting services, specializing in themanagement, implementation, development, and maintenance of information systems.
Our expertise spans a wide range of industries, includingbanking,insurance,telecommunications,energy,transportation, andservices, where we collaborate with over 150 active partners to deliver innovative, tailored solutions.
At Aubay, we’re committed to empowering businesses through digital transformation, offering cutting-edge technology and deep industry knowledge to drive success.

What are you going to do:
- Design, develop, and optimizescalable fullstack solutionsusing.NET 6+ (C#)on the backend andAngular 15+on the frontend.
- Maintain and evolve legacy features developed inASP Classic + jQueryas part of a gradual migration to modern technologies.
- Build and maintain high-performing.NET WebAPIs, utilizingEntity Framework,LINQ, andraw SQLfor efficient data access and management.
- Write clean, maintainable code with strongautomated unit test coverageusingxUnit.
- Developresponsive and interactive web applicationsusing Angular, with close attention toUI/UX design feasibility and performance.
- Optimize frontend and backend components formaximum performance and scalability.
- Work withJira,Azure DevOps, andGitLabto manage tasks, version control, and team collaboration.
- Participate actively in anAgile environment, contributing to iterative, high-quality software delivery.

What we are looking for:
- Bachelor’s degree inComputer Science,Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline.
- 3 to 5 years of hands-on experience in.NET (6 or later)development andAngular (version 15 or higher).
- Strong understanding ofdatabase modeling and design, particularly withSQL Server.
- Experience writing unit tests withxUnitto ensure code reliability.
- Familiarity withDevOps practicesandCI/CD pipelinesfor efficient deployment and integration.
- Comfortable usingJira,GitLab,Azure DevOps, or similar tools in collaborative development environments.
- Practical knowledge ofAgile methodologies, with the ability to thrive in team-based, fast-paced settings.
- Strongproblem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and deliver robust solutions.
- Excellentcommunication skills, able to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical team members.
- Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

What do we offer you?
At Aubay, we believe in creating an environment where both your career and well-being thrive. Here's what you can expect when you join us:
- Health Insurance:Your health and well-being are a priority.
- Feedback&Coffee:A unique system that integrates Aubay'sPerformance Management Cyclewith regular feedback sessions and aCareer Progression Model, designed to foster your growth and success.
- Working Model:Hybrid model with office in Lisbon.
- A Tailored Training Academy:We’re dedicated to your professional development with bothtechnical and behavioral training. Frome-Learningandclassroom sessionstoMeet&Techs,Webinars, andMentoring, we provide a variety of learning opportunities to suit your needs.
- Exciting Events & Teambuilding:Enjoy a vibrant company culture through regulareventsandteam-building activitiesthat strengthen relationships and enhance collaboration.

What makes us different?
At Aubay, we foster a unique environment where people come first. Here’s what makes us different:
- A Culture Built on Core Values:Our organizational culture thrives ontransparency,team spirit,regular feedback, andcontinuous learning— all designed to support your personal and professional growth.
- Recognition & Rewards:Enjoyreference prizesand abirthday giftas a token of appreciation for being part of our team.
- Freedom in Expression:We embrace acasual dress code, allowing you to feel comfortable and authentic at work.
- A Friendly and Inclusive Atmosphere:At Aubay,we know your name, and we communicate informally — fostering a relaxed, close-knit environment.
- Grow with Us:You will grow alongside inspiring colleagues who support and challenge you.Isn't this the best way to develop professionally?

If we’ve sparked your interest, we’re now ready to ignite your enthusiasm.Are you ready for the first step?

title: Scrum master
description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!
@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it,  and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.
At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!
We are looking for an Amazing:Scrum master
Seniority:Mid (3-5 years)
Type of position:Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!
The amazing you, will have:
- Proven experience as a Scrum Master 5+ years, ideally within cross-functional Agile teams.
- Solid understanding of Agile and Scrum principles and frameworks.
- Strong facilitation and coaching skills with the ability to influence and lead without authority.
- Experience with tools such as Jira, Confluence, Azure DevOps, or equivalent.
- Fluent in English C1, Portuguese B2.
- Excellent communication and conflict-resolution skills.
- Comfortable working in fast-paced and changing environments.
- Scrum Master certification (CSM, PSM I/II, or equivalent).
- Experience in SAFe, LeSS, or other scaled Agile environments.
- Background in software development, QA, or product ownership is a plus.
- Experience in Agile transformation or coaching multiple teams.
Why should you become part of our family?
- You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
- Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity

- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you

- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
- Full Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Who are we?
Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!
We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.
All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

title: Scrum master
description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!
@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it,  and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.
At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!
We are looking for an Amazing:Scrum master
Seniority:Mid (3-5 years)
Type of position:Hybrid model in Lisbon. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!
The amazing you, will have:
- Proven experience as a Scrum Master 5+ years, ideally within cross-functional Agile teams.
- Solid understanding of Agile and Scrum principles and frameworks.
- Strong facilitation and coaching skills with the ability to influence and lead without authority.
- Experience with tools such as Jira, Confluence, Azure DevOps, or equivalent.
- Fluent in English C1, Portuguese B2.
- Excellent communication and conflict-resolution skills.
- Comfortable working in fast-paced and changing environments.
- Scrum Master certification (CSM, PSM I/II, or equivalent).
- Experience in SAFe, LeSS, or other scaled Agile environments.
- Background in software development, QA, or product ownership is a plus.
- Experience in Agile transformation or coaching multiple teams.
- You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
- Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
- Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
- International projects in Benelux:you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
- Type of projects(depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for youFull Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your homeFull Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
- Full Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
- Take care of your well-being:Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote
- In hybrid Systems:Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
- Full Remote projects:If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
- Full Onsite projects:if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Who are we?
Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!
We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.
All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

title: Network and Service Manager
description:
Fundada em 2005, em Lisboa, a agap2IT é uma organização europeia na área dos Sistemas de Informação, Ciência e Tecnologia. A capacidade de intervir globalmente aliada à elevada experiência e know-how técnico, funcional e de negócio da equipa, garantem a excelência da resposta aos mais exigentes desafios.
Com o espírito agapiano e valores como a valorização humana, empreendedorismo e responsabilidade social, mais do que um projeto, terás a oportunidade de criares uma carreira à tua medida.
Descrição do perfil:
- Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou semelhante;- Experiência profissional com (W)LAN (Cisco ou Extreme Networks, Fortinet / Aruba);- Conhecimentos em redes móveis 4/5G (APNs, Private LTE);- Conhecimentos em configuração de redes LAN e WAN, SD-WAN (VLANs, Routing [BGP, OSPF], VPNs IPSEC) e troubleshooting;- Capacidade de coordenação e gestão de serviços com os fornecedores e equipas de 1ª linha;- Familiaridade com scripting e automações (Python, TCL, Bash ou PowerShell);- Bom nível de inglês.
Requisito obrigatório:Residir em Portugal ou dispor de documentação legal para o efeito.
Os nossosincentivos agapianossão:
- Seguro de saúde;- Seguro de vida e acidentes pessoais;- Formações (técnicas, comportamentais e linguísticas) e certificações (técnicas) gratuitas;- Protocolo com plataforma de descontos em diferentes setores;- Plano Vodafone (comunicações e banda larga móvel);- Acesso a consultas de nutrição, psicologia e medicina geral gratuitas;- Acompanhamento de progressão de carreira contínuo e personalizado.
Na agap2IT defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!
Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.
Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas. Junta-te a nós!

description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:
Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.

What are we looking for?
- 6+ years of experience as a Java Fullstack Developer
- Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (experience with Angular, React, or Vue.js is a plus)
- Experienced with both SQL and NoSQL databases
- Familiar with Microservices, Cloud, and Container Architectures
- Desirable knowledge of Domain-Driven Design (DDD), event sourcing, reactive programming, automated testing, and security
- Excellent oral and written English communication skills; German is a plus
- Residence in Portugal is mandatory
- Project based in Lisbon or Porto

What do we have to offer you?
- Health Insurance;
- Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
- Working model: hybrid;
- A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
- Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?
- Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
- Reference prizes and birthday present;
- We don’t have a dress code;
- We know your name and all address each other informally;
- You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?
We are waiting for you! Send you CV to<endereço ocultado>

title: Qlik Cloud Consultant
description:
Hey Data Lover!Are you ready to embark on this exciting adventure?

With us, you will be able to enhance all your analytical, technological, and business skills and capabilities.
It's time to take off into the future through the power of data! Join us and get ready to break the rules and reach your best version
Discover the power of SDG: global leaders in the data industry

At SDG we work for half of the IBEX-35 companies, but also for a multitude of international companies. Thanks to the analytics boom, we are at aconstant pace of growth, and since 1994 we have become thetrusted partnerfor companies that want to maximize the full potential of their data.

What will be your mission?
- Implementation of projectsmaintaining the SDG philosophy (gathering requirements and developments, functional and technical design, implementation of error control processes and data quality, optimization of environments, data modeling);
- Build and maintainpositive relationshipsnot only with client staff at all levels, but also with your SDG peers, as you adopt a role as person of reference for these topics;
- Project development, work withDWH, ETL and SQL;
- Leverage tools in BI product stack not only to create compellingdata visualizations and dashboardsbut also propel themultiple backend functionalitieswithin Qlik Could;
- Be updated on thelatest technological trendsin the field of Analytics.

What will make you succeed in this position?
- Bachelor/Masterin a field that emphasizes data analysis (Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics);
- Experience over5 years in the field of Analytics, ideally in service/consulting companies;
- Experience working withQlik tools(Qlikview, Qlik Sense, NPrinting, among others).
- Experience working withQlik Cloud(mandatory).
- Passion foranalytics.
- Innovative spiritwith balanced customer, business and technology orientation.
- Interest in challenges,commitment, integrity, maturity, ability to work as a team and a high sense ofresponsibility.
- Fluentlevel of English.

What makes us different?
In our projects, data and technology are the protagonists, we will train you so that you can work with the latest on the market (we have an innovation area where we promote new partnerships with technological manufacturers and R&D centers).

You will haveevery opportunity to reach your best version, with a completelypersonalized career planin which you will learn by yourself and have the support of your other colleagues.

You will set your own pace! You will speak with your Managerevery six monthsto sharefeedbackandestablish new goals, and, based on your results, there will be asalary review.

We are abig community, from day 1 we will try to make your life easier. Both your colleagues and the rest of the team will always be willing to help you and offer you all their support.

You will collaborate and work on a daily basis withgreat references(technical and/or business), they will be happy to teach you everything possible and will be proud to see you grow.

With usSmartworkis possible. You will experience a way of working in which everyone manages their own time.

We are a brand with purpose. We believe thatdiversityandinclusionhelp promote a culture of creativity, allowing us to overcome new situations and challenges.


JOIN NOW, WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

title: Technology Portfolio Specialist
description:
COCUS Prosourceis all about People! We are proud to deliver skilled services and products developed by great talent, with attitude and ambition to work in innovative IT solutions.
Emotions are part of us, we encourage everyone to be what they truly are in a collaborative, informal, transparent, and open environment, that is why we take our partnerships seriously - supporting as a Talent Acquisition specialized partner on the recruitment for companies with the same People first mindset as we have!
What you will be doing:
As aTechnology Portfolio Specialist, you will operate at the strategic level, working closely with leadership teams to assess, monitor, and optimize the financial health and performance of our technology project portfolio. You will partner with the PMO (Project Management Office), but your focus will be on analytics, insight generation, and executive-level communication. Key responsibilities include:
- Evaluating portfolio health from a financial and risk perspective, identifying trends, budget consumption, variances, and interdependencies across multiple initiatives.
- Acting as a trusted advisor to leadership by providing timely, data-driven insights and recommendations to guide decision-making and portfolio prioritization.
- Designing and improving portfolio management methodologies, especially in how project information is gathered, analyzed, and reported.
- Working collaboratively with the PMO to anticipate and mitigate risks across programs.
- Producing high-impact reports and clear, executive-ready presentations that influence key stakeholders.
- Leading portfolio performance reviews and helping steer decision-making on project continuation, redirection, or termination.
- Supporting continuous improvement in portfolio management through the definition of meaningful metrics and performance indicators.
What we are looking for:
We are looking for a strategic thinker with strong analytical and communication skills, capable of navigating financial data, governance structures, and executive expectations. You should feel comfortable owning portfolio analytics and bringing structure to complexity. You will bring:
- Fluency in English, with exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
- Proven experience presenting insights and influencing executive stakeholders.
- Strong financial acumen with a background in finance, business analysis, or investment decision support.
- Experience designing or evolving portfolio governance or information intake processes.
- Solid experience in technology portfolio management or PMO environments.
- Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret metrics and propose data-driven actions ideally with PowerBI.
- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and familiarity with portfolio management tools.
- A self-starter mindset with the ability to work independently and drive initiatives with minimal supervision.
What will be a plus:
- Experience as a Project Manager or working within a Project Management Office (PMO) environment.
What we can offer you:
- Permanent contract with long-term career prospects
- Competitive salary aligned with your experience and expertise
- Annual target bonus based on performance
- Daily meal allowance
- Health insurance and Life insurance
- Access to Employee Assistance Program for well-being and support
- A flexible work model, including the possibility to work remotely from anywhere in Portugal.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
About YellowIpe
Our mission is to inspire the connection between technology and people, we foster the best of our professionals through our expertise in finding and attracting the best talent for the best projects. The Focus on People, Collaboration and Commitment are the pillars that guide us in this trajectory.
Join the yellow team as our new Senior DevOps Engineer!
What You’ll Be Doing:
- Design, build, and sustain scalable, robust infrastructure to support the high-demand applications and services.
- Automate and optimize deployment workflows, CI/CD pipelines, and routine maintenance activities to improve efficiency and minimize downtime.
- Continuously monitor and enhance system performance, proactively detecting and addressing issues to ensure optimal availability and dependability.
- Work closely with development, data, and security teams to guarantee smooth integration of infrastructure changes and code updates.
- Champion security best practices by establishing and managing access controls, network security, and compliance policies across the infrastructure.
- Lead the response to infrastructure-related incidents and troubleshooting, ensuring quick and effective resolutions to maintain service continuity.
- Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members, promoting DevOps best practices and nurturing a culture of continuous improvement and learning within the team.
- Stay informed about industry developments and new technologies, introducing innovative solutions to enhance DevOps processes and toolsets.
What You Need to Have:
- Proficiency in working with Linux environments.
- Hands-on experience with DevOps and GitOps practices.
- Familiarity with Kubernetes and containerized applications (such as Docker).
- Solid understanding of Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform.
- Experience utilizing Monitoring Tools such as Google Cloud Monitoring/StackDriver, Grafana, Prometheus/AlertManager, and NewRelic.
- Working knowledge of Jenkins for automation and pipeline management.
- Expertise in CI/CD processes and tools.
- Strong team player with a solution-oriented, proactive attitude and a “Get Things Done” mindset.
- Passionate about technology and innovation.
- Proficiency in English (both written and spoken).
What would be a plus for us:
- Experience/Knowledge with Kafka, Prometheus/AlertManager, Grafana, Elasticsearch/ Logstash/ Kibana, Vault, Redis, MySQL, DNS;
- Experience with PHP, Javascript, GoLang;
- Experience provisioning servers and services using AWS, Azure, or GCP;
- Experience/Knowledge with Istio;
- Good know-how about Cloud Networking including VPC Management, Routing, NAT, and overall troubleshooting using TCPdump analysis;
- Familiar with SCRUM methodology.
Location Requirements:
- Remote - Candidates must reside in Portugal
Apply for this opportunity in ourwebsite! =)

title: Master Data Specialist
description:
Sua Missão:
Como Especialista em Dados Mestres de TI, integrando a Equipe Interna de TI da Rovensa, sua missão será gerenciar, manter e garantir a integridade, a precisão e a consistência dos dados mestres em todo o Portfólio de Soluções Corporativas da Rovensa. Você será responsável por dar suporte aos diferentes departamentos e fornecer dados precisos e oportunos, necessários para a operação dos negócios e para ajudar a Rovensa a realizar seu ambicioso sonho de alimentar o planeta, ajudando os agricultores a produzir alimentos saudáveis ​​e nutritivos para todos, em todo o mundo.

Suas Responsabilidades:
- Gestão de Dados: Gerenciar e supervisionar a entrada, manutenção e saída de dados mestres no sistema SAP MDG
- Qualidade dos Dados: Garantir a precisão, consistência e integridade dos dados mestres em todas as soluções corporativas da Rovensa, utilizadas por diferentes áreas de negócios
- Resolução de Problemas: Identificar, solucionar e resolver problemas relacionados a dados mestres nos sistemas SAP
- Documentação: Criar e manter a documentação dos processos e procedimentos de dados mestres
- Colaboração: Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com outros departamentos para entender suas necessidades de dados e garantir que o sistema SAP atenda a essas necessidades
- Treinamento: Treinar e auxiliar os usuários no uso correto do sistema SAP MDG, visando a qualidade e a consistência dos dados
- Testes do Sistema: Apoiar os testes dos processos de gestão de dados mestres durante a implementação de novas soluções SAP e/ou atualizações de lançamento
- Auditorias: Realizar auditorias e revisões regulares para manter a integridade dos dados
- Melhorias: Recomendar e implementar melhorias no sistema SAP MDG com base na análise de dados, visando aprimorar os processos de captura e qualidade de dados
- Atualizações: Manter-se atualizado com as últimas tendências e tecnologias em gestão de dados mestres SAP
- Projetos: Participar de projetos de Rollout SAP do Modelo Rovensa e/ou implementação de novas Soluções/Releases SAP, apoiando as atividades de preparação, validação e migração dos dados mestres necessários para a implementação dos processos SAP.
- Monitoramento: Monitorar continuamente as atividades desenvolvidas pelos recursos terceirizados para garantir a transferência do know-how necessário para a manutenção futura dos processos de negócio por eles desenvolvidos e implementados, bem como garantir a elaboração de todos os manuais técnicos e de usuário.

O Talento que buscamos:
- Formação superior em Engenharia da Computação ou similar;
- Mínimo de 3 anos de experiência profissional na área;
- Experiência comprovada em gestão de dados mestres SAP (em todos os módulos SAP);
- Experiência em configuração e utilização do SAP MDG é valorizada;
- Proficiência em inglês e espanhol é valorizada;
- Alto nível de autonomia e responsabilidade;
- Fortes habilidades de comunicação interpessoal;
- Senso de colaboração e dedicação.

O que oferecemos:
- Uma excelente oportunidade para colaborar com uma empresa internacional em constante crescimento.
- Modelo de trabalho híbrido
- Integração em uma equipe dinâmica e desafiadora.
- Remuneração e benefícios de acordo com a experiência.
Envia-nos a tua candidatura indicando o assunto “Master Data” através do email:<endereço ocultado>

We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Does this sound like you?
Come build with us innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.

description:
We're looking for an experiencedProject Managerwith strong expertise inAgile methodologies, particularlySCRUMandKanban. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully delivering software projects while effectively managing teams, stakeholders, and resources.
You will lead cross-functional teams, facilitate agile ceremonies, and ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and with high quality. This role requires excellent organizational skills, strong communication abilities, and a deep understanding of software development processes.
Responsibilities
- Lead and facilitate agile ceremonies including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, and sprint reviews
- Manage project scope, timeline, budget, and resources while maintaining quality standards
- Remove impediments and resolve conflicts to ensure smooth team operation
- Track and report on project metrics, KPIs, and team velocity
- Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize requirements and manage expectations
- Create and maintain project documentation including roadmaps, release plans, and sprint backlogs
- Coach team members on agile principles and best practices
- Identify risks and develop mitigation strategies proactively
- Foster a culture of continuous improvement and team empowerment
- Coordinate with other departments and ensure alignment with business objectives
Requirements
- 3-5 yearsof experience in project management, preferably in software development
- Proven expertise inSCRUM,Kanban, or other agile methodologies
- Strong understanding of software development lifecycle
- Experience with project management and collaboration tools (Jira, Confluence, Trello, Teamwork, etc.)
- Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills
- Ability to manage multiple priorities and adapt to changing requirements
- Strong problem-solving and decision-making capabilities
- Basic technical knowledge to effectively communicate with development teams
- Experience facilitating discussions and resolving conflicts
- Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent practical experience
Nice to Have
- Professional certifications such as Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), Project Management Professional (PMP), or similar
- Experience with scaled agile frameworks (SAFe, LeSS, etc.)
- Background in software development or technical role
- Experience with remote or distributed teams
- Knowledge of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines
- Experience in the same industry as our clients
What We Offer
- Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
- Flexible remote work environment
- Professional development opportunities
- Collaborative and supportive company culture
- Work with diverse projects and technologies
- Opportunity to shape and improve our project management practices
- Health and wellness benefits package
About Us
We areHumode, a trusted technology partner specialized in software development, cloud computing, and building scalable digital solutions.With over 10 years of experience, we empower businesses through custom software tailored to their unique needs — always prioritizing quality, security, and human-centered design.We believe technology shouldenhance people’s livesandenable businesses to thrive.Our environment is highly collaborative, pragmatic, and mission-driven, and we work closely with clients across Europe.

title: Cloud  Architect
Java Developer
Full Stack Developer
description:
Full Stack Developer
Na Kwalit, acreditamos que a tecnologia quando conjugada com fortes valores humanos pode realmente impulsionar mudanças para melhor nas nossas vidas! Como parte dessa crença, criamos produtos que ajudam a ter impacto na vida das organizações.
É aqui que tu entras. Procuramos pessoas que tenham o perfil ou queiram evoluir como full stack developer.
Como fullstack developer iras fazer parte de uma equipa de desenvolvimento responsável por criar, desenvolver e manter as nossas aplicaçoes cloud para as areas de omnichannel for Retail bem como de Shopfloor solutions for manufactoring para os nossos clientes que se encontram distribuidos pela Europa, Africa, Caraíbas e América Latina.

Isto é o que tu és:
- Tens umaLicenciatura ou Mestrado em Informática e Computadores, Sistemas de Informação ou Ciência da Computação
- TensInteresse por projetos de inovação tecnológica
- Tens gosto emcolaborar e fazer parte de uma equipamultidisciplinar. Apenas queremos jogadores de equipa!
- Boa capacidade de comunicaçãoe facilidade em trabalhar em equipa, com foco naresolução de problemas
- Ésdedicado e esforçadono que fazes!
- És uma pessoaresponsável,Honesto(a),e comvalores e princípios.

Se até aqui te identificas comtodosos pontos, continuar a ler.
Isto é o que tu trazes ou onde pretendes aprender e crescer:
Procuramos pessoas com experiência senior \ mid level. Mas tambem adoramos incorporar novas pessoas que queiram começar a sua jornada de trabalho connosco e desta forma desenvolver capacidades nesta area. Por esse motivo, quer tenhas experiência ou não, continua a ler.

Que skills gostaríamos que tivesses ou que aprendesses connosco:
- Conhecimentos na implementação de soluções de software avançadas e complexas seguindo os padrões de desenho adequados, nomeadamente na implementação deAPIs REST de serviços
- Conhecimentos emJavascript/Typescript
- Conhecimentos com frameworks de desenvolvimentobackend -  Node.js
- Conhecimentos com frameworks de desenvolvimentofrontend - Angular
- Conhecimentos comsistemas de mensagens -  Kafka;
- Conhecimentos em ferramentas degestão de bases de dadoscomo MS SQL Server, MySQL ou PostgreSQL.

Isto é o que tu ganhas
Na Kwalit, valorizamos o equilíbrio entre trabalho e a vida pessoal. Isso é muito importante para nós. Como Full Stack developer, podes contar com:
- Um salário base competitivo em função da tua experiência ou EstagioAtivarno  caso de ser a tua primeira experiencia de trabalho pós faculdade!
- Prémios em função da tua performance (Depois do 1º Ano)
- Revisões salariais anuais mediante o merito demonstrado!
- Seguro Saúde (Depois do 1º Ano)
- Tardes de Sexta-feira livre a cada 2 Semanas
- Flexibilidade de trabalho remoto deforma parcial.Full remote nao é opção!
- Um bom ambiente de trabalho, e muito mais! Anda conhecer quem somos, o que fazemos e o nosso/teu projeto para o qual esta oferta se enquadra!

Isto é a  Kwalit
A felicidade é ou deveria ser o propósito de qualquer empresa!
Empresas que fomentam a felicidade têm colaboradores mais felizes, melhores resultados e clientes ainda mais felizes. Na Kwalit, acreditamos que com a solução de gestão adequada é possível ajudar a criar empresas felizes onde os colaboradores se sentem mais orientados, apoiados e informados para desempenharem melhor as suas funções no dia a dia.
Por isso, desde 2012 focamo-nos na implementação e no desenvolvimento de soluções de gestão e colaboração para melhorar a forma como as empresas trabalham, criando um maior valor acrescentado para todo o ecossistema laboral.
Fundada em 2012 e sendo parceiro internacional daExact Softwaree doGrupo Cegide com clientes e projetos ativos em mais de 10 países espalhados pela Europa, Africa, Caraíbas e América Latina combinamos a nossa experiencia adquirida com a ambição de fazer mais e melhor para apoiar e ajudar as empresas que confiam em nós!

Como empregador, aceitamos nossa responsabilidade social.
Acreditamos que as empresas têm a responsabilidade e o poder de criar uma sociedade mais justa, mais equitativa, preservando os recursos ambientais, respeitando a diversidade e promovendo o bem-estar para todos. Acreditamos que todos merecem uma vida digna e oportunidades iguais e por esse motivo parte dos nossos resultados anuais são sempre destinados a apoiar causas e instituições de solidariedade, que promovem a inclusão social.  Fazemos a nossa pequena parte hoje para que todos juntos possamos criar um melhor amanhã.

Queres fazer parte de um projeto com futuro?
Envia-nos o teu CV e carta de motivação para<endereço ocultado>

description:
We are looking for a skilled and experienced .NET Engineer to join our team and collaborate on medium to large-scale projects involving complex web-based system architectures built on Microsoft technologies. If you have a solid background in .NET frameworks and a strong command of C#, alongside a commitment to building secure, high-performance systems and an interest in joining an international organization, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities :
- Develop and maintain web-based systems with complex architectures, leveraging the .NET ecosystem and C#;
- Work within a range of application architectures, including MVC, Microservices, REST API-based designs, Event-Driven Architecture, and Model-Driven Design;
- Design and implement Single Page Applications (SPAs) using frameworks such as Angular or React, HTML5, and Bootstrap for responsive, user-friendly interfaces;
- Manage data using Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle;
- Write secure, efficient code while adhering to cybersecurity best practices;
- Ensure regular reporting in order to optimize the monitoring of activities, the transfer of knowledge and documentation within the development team

- Bachelor's or master's degree in IT or related field
- Have at least 5 years of experience on medium/large projects related to the development of complex architectures for web-based systems on Microsoft technologies
- Familiar with various application architectures (MVC, Microservices, REST API, EDA, Model-Driven Design)
- Good command of .NET frameworks and C# programming language
- Good knowledge and proven experience of database management systems, particularly Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle
- Good knowledge on data modelling and data management
- Experience with SPA Frameworks like Angular or React, HTML5 and Bootstrap
- Experience on writing secure code, prioritizing cybersecurity, as well as maintaining optimization and efficiency
- Experience with version control systems as GIT
- Good knowledge of software development tools, methodologies and best practices
- Good command of English is mandatory and French is considered as an asset

Global packaging :
- Dynamic work environment
- Work on exciting projects with cutting-edge technology
- Permanent full-time contract (CDI)
- Meal vouchers
- Health insurance complementary
- Company car (is an option)
- Career development and support
- Hybrid working model (1-2 days remote per week)

Natech Lda. is a global supplier of premium genetic, high quality, non-irradiated, hand-trimmed, perfectly cured GMP medical cannabis dried flowers. Our team has been involved in multiple different medical cannabis projects since the beginning of the industry in Europe (2015).

Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for an IT Support Specialist (f/m/d) at Natech Lda. located in Seixal.

title: Labs Process & Performance Analyst
description:
About Nonius
Nonius is a leading provider ofGuest Technology Solutionsfor the hospitality industry, serving over500,000 hotel rooms worldwide.Our solutions includecloud and edge computing, AI, IoT, networking, and digital guest experiences,helping hotels and other industries enhance their operations and guest satisfaction. Beyond hospitality, we provide technology forhealthcare, maritime, and co-living spaces,integrating with global partners likeSamsung, LG, Google, and Appleto drive seamless innovation.
About Nonius Labs (R&D Division)
Nonius Labs is theresearch and development (R&D) division of Nonius,responsible for designing, building, and integrating cutting-edge technologies into our product ecosystem. We developnext-generation platforms, APIs, cloud services, and edge appliances,working closely with operations teams to accelerate innovation and bring high-quality solutions to market.
To support our growth, we are looking for aLabs Process & Performance Analyst, approx. 3 to 5 years of experience, who understandstechnology, software architecture and system integration, someone who can assist theDivision Directorin driving structured decision-making, improving workflows and ensuring smooth execution of R&D initiatives.This is a full-time, on-site position at our Maia, Portugal office.
Key Responsibilities and Objectives
- Gain a deep understanding of Nonius Labs’ technology stack, product components, and system integrations.
- Identify how different software, hardware, and cloud services interact within the Nonius ecosystem.
- Assist in structuring technical documentation and product roadmaps, ensuring clarity and strategic alignment.
- Ensure that R&D and product development processes are followed and documented properly.
- Maintain up-to-date roadmaps and process documentation across different product areas.
- Support the Division Director and Team leaders  in streamlining processes for faster decision-making and execution.
- Track KPIs related to R&D efficiency, resource allocation, and product development progress.
- Generate management reports for leadership, highlighting bottlenecks, dependencies, and optimization opportunities.
- Ensure visibility into technology adoption, integration timelines, and product scalability.
- Provide structured insights and recommendations to help optimize product development cycles.
Must Have
- Tech enthusiast with a strong understanding of software, cloud platforms, and integrations.
- Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Management, or a related field.
- 3 to 5 years of relevant experience, in a tech-driven environment.
- Fluency in English (written and spoken).
- Strong analytical skills to break down technical components into structured processes.
- Excellent communication skills to collaborate with engineers, product managers, and leadership.
- Organized and process-oriented mindset, with high attention to detail.
- Experience in project planning, resource tracking, and coordinating shared resources across teams
Nice to Have
- Familiarity with IoT, API integrations, or cloud technologies.
- Experience with data analysis tools (Google Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar).
- Basic understanding of software development lifecycles and agile methodologies.
- Exposure to automation tools or basic scripting to support reporting or process efficiency.
- Experience working directly with technical teams (e.g. developers, DevOps, QA).
What's great in the job?
- Great team of smart people, in a friendly and open culture
- Real responsabilities and challenges in a fast evolving company
- Expand your knowledge of various countries and regions
- Great career opportunity in a fast-evolving Technology company
- Contribute to the greater experience of millions of Travellers around the World!
Apply here:<endereço ocultado>

Sempre gostaste do mundo das telecomunicações? Então vais gostar deste projeto, pois aqui terás a possibilidade de inovar nas áreas da TV, internet e voz. Farás ainda parte de uma equipa cujos projetos terão grande exposição a nível nacional.

- Formação superior em Engenharia Informática ou similar;- Experiência na monitorização, operação e administração de sistemas críticos;- Experiência no desenvolvimento, manutenção e operação de sistemas distribuídos em arquiteturas Unix;- Conhecimentos avançados de bases de dados relacionais, obrigatoriamente MySQL e PostgreSQL;- Experiência em instalação, configuração e diagnóstico de problemas em sistemas Web, nomeadamente com Apache e Nginx;- Experiência com Docker e Kubernetes;- Experiência com ferramentas de CI/CD, preferencialmente Jenkins;- Conhecimentos de ferramentas de automatização, monitorização e gestão de logs com Elastic Search-Kibana e Prometheus-Grafana;- Conhecimentos de BDs não relacionais (redis, MongoDB, etc);- Experiência com bash scripting.;- Disponibilidade para serviço de prevenção, 1 semana por mês.
O que oferecemos?
- Seguro de Saúde;- Plano de formação ajustado e personalizado, com um orçamento para gastares nas formações e livros técnicos que considerares necessários;- Feedback constante e acompanhamento para que possas crescer profissionalmente;- Processo de onboarding remoto;- Eventos de equipa todos os semestres para que possas viver novas aventuras;- Descontos e ofertas exclusivas nos nossos parceiros;- Cultura de proximidade e transparência. As tuas ideias e necessidades são ouvidas e valorizadas por nós!
Candidaturas:Submete a tua candidaturaaqui.Para além disso, se também quiseres estar a par das novidades do mercado de trabalho sabe maisaqui.

title: Outsystems Developer
Staff Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About YellowIpe
Our mission is to inspire the connection between technology and people, we foster the best of our professionals through our expertise in finding and attracting the best talent for the best projects. The Focus on People, Collaboration and Commitment are the pillars that guide us in this trajectory.
Join the yellow team as our new Staff Machine Learning Engineer!
What You’ll Be Doing:
- Lead initiatives with substantial scope and uncertainty, often related to developing new products or revenue opportunities.
- Play a critical role in shaping the team’s roadmap by identifying strategic and technical priorities and proposing areas of focus.
- Make a significant impact by sharing expertise in building ML systems, with a particular focus on advancements in Generative AI.
- Provide key insights to executive leadership regarding emerging technical initiatives and opportunities aligned with industry trends.
- Actively engage in the design, development, evaluation, deployment, and enhancement of products through hands-on AI/ML contributions.
- Build and maintain data processing workflows to gather and process the information needed for model training and evaluation.
- Collaborate closely with Product, Data, and Engineering teams to define and deliver AI/ML-powered features for both internal and external stakeholders.
- Identify opportunities for optimization by introducing and implementing processes that enhance the team’s efficiency and delivery speed.
- Tackle complex, undefined, and challenging technical issues, where previous team efforts may not offer clear solutions.
What You Need to Have:
- Over 6 years of professional experience in Machine Learning, preferably in AI-focused companies.
- Deep technical expertise in Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI, with proven experience delivering applications powered by these technologies.
- Experience leading and managing complex and loosely defined projects from ideation through implementation and maintenance.
- Hands-on experience building and maintaining production-grade machine learning systems.
- Strong background in SQL and Python, along with experience developing production-ready software.
- Proficient knowledge of the Python data ecosystem (such as numpy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn, etc.).
- Experience providing technical guidance and mentoring team members.
- Quick learning ability and the capacity to deeply understand new problems and domains.
- Strong communication skills to effectively convey concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
- A self-driven and independent mindset, with the ability to work autonomously.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and adaptability in handling shifting or conflicting priorities.
- Proven track record of building scalable and reliable software applications.
What would be a plus for us:
- Experience working in a fast-paced environment and doing different chores;
- Experience building data processing pipelines;
- Experience using cloud platforms like GCP or AWS.
Location Requirements:
- Remote - Candidates must reside in Portugal
Apply for this opportunity in ourwebsite! =)

RESPONSABILIDADES
- Adquirir e manter um nível alto de conhecimento funcional do ERP e todas as suas tecnologias e produtos relacionados
- Ajudar a equipa de suporte na resolução de problemas do cliente em tempo útil, e de forma a atendermos às suas expectativas
- Trabalhar em projetos de implementação do ERP e produtos complementares de mobilidade de forma a atender aos requisitos de negócio do cliente
- Trabalhar em projetos de implementação e melhorias de funcionalidade para sistemas existentes e projetos de atualização
- Trabalhar com a equipa de entrega de serviços para melhorar continuamente os processos dos nossos clientes
COMPETÊNCIAS
- Licenciatura em Informática de Gestão ou similar
- Capacidades de desenvolvimento aplicacional
- Competências de comunicação escrita, falada e auditiva
- Capacidade de aprender novas ideias e aptidões (tanto técnicas quanto comportamentais) com rapidez e confiança
- Auto motivação para trabalhar de forma independente quando necessário
- Capacidade para trabalhar livremente em Portugal e Espanha. Viajar para outros países do mundo é uma possibilidade com essa função, apesar de o trabalho remoto ser aplicado sempre que possível.
- Possuir carta de condução
EXPERIÊNCIA
- Tens experiência na implementação de Software de gestão (ERP)?
- Boa capacidade de análise de requisitos e necessidades do cliente?
- Conhecimentos de programação VB6, .NET  bem como conhecimentos em SQL?
Ou
- Acabaste de te formar e queres começar a trabalhar e ganhar experiência?
- Estás elegível para Estágio ATIVAR / IEFP?
Anda iniciar tua carreira connosco!
Temosprogramas de onboardingque te ajudarão a ganhar a experiência necessária!

Isto é o que tu ganhas
Na Kwalit, valorizamos o equilíbrio entre trabalho e a vida pessoal. Isso é muito importante para nós. Como Full Stack developer, podes contar com:
- Um salário base competitivo em função da tua experiência ou EstagioAtivarno  caso de ser a tua primeira experiencia de trabalho pós faculdade!
- Prémios em função da tua performance (Depois do 1º Ano)
- Revisões salariais anuais mediante o merito demonstrado!
- Seguro Saúde (Depois do 1º Ano)
- Tardes de Sexta-feira livre a cada 2 Semanas
- Flexibilidade de trabalho remoto deforma parcial.Full remote nao é opção!
- Um bom ambiente de trabalho, e muito mais! Anda conhecer quem somos, o que fazemos e o nosso/teu projeto para o qual esta oferta se enquadra!

Isto é a  Kwalit
A felicidade é ou deveria ser o propósito de qualquer empresa!
Empresas que fomentam a felicidade têm colaboradores mais felizes, melhores resultados e clientes ainda mais felizes. Na Kwalit, acreditamos que com a solução de gestão adequada é possível ajudar a criar empresas felizes onde os colaboradores se sentem mais orientados, apoiados e informados para desempenharem melhor as suas funções no dia a dia.
Por isso, desde 2012 focamo-nos na implementação e no desenvolvimento de soluções de gestão e colaboração para melhorar a forma como as empresas trabalham, criando um maior valor acrescentado para todo o ecossistema laboral.
Fundada em 2012 e sendo parceiro internacional daExact Softwaree doGrupo Primaverae com clientes e projetos ativos em mais de 10 países espalhados pela Europa, Africa, Caraíbas e América Latina combinamos a nossa experiencia adquirida com a ambição de fazer mais e melhor para apoiar e ajudar as empresas que confiam em nós!

Como empregador, aceitamos nossa responsabilidade social.
Acreditamos que as empresas têm a responsabilidade e o poder de criar uma sociedade mais justa, mais equitativa, preservando os recursos ambientais, respeitando a diversidade e promovendo o bem-estar para todos. Acreditamos que todos merecem uma vida digna e oportunidades iguais e por esse motivo parte dos nossos resultados anuais são sempre destinados a apoiar causas e instituições de solidariedade, que promovem a inclusão social.
Fazemos a nossa pequena parte hoje para que todos juntos possamos criar um melhor amanhã.

Queres fazer parte de um projeto com futuro?
Envia-nos o teu CV e carta de motivação para<endereço ocultado>

title: Software Engineer - MES

description:
We are looking for aLead Backend Engineerto drive the backend architecture, development, and scalability of our gaming platform. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, innovative environment and is passionate about crafting high-performance, secure, and scalable backend systems. As a lead, you’ll be a key decision-maker on technical direction and mentor other engineers across teams.

Responsibilities
- Design, implement, and maintain scalable backend systems for our games and platform.
- Own backend architecture decisions, ensuring high availability and performance.
- Collaborate closely with front-end developers, data engineers, and product managers.
- Lead initiatives to improve backend system observability, performance, and maintainability.
- Drive the adoption of best practices in API design, microservices, testing, and security.
- Mentor and support other backend engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence.
- Participate in code reviews and contribute to continuous technical improvement.
- Work cross-functionally with QA, analytics, DevOps, and game development teams.
Technical Skills
The ideal candidate will have expertise in the following technologies:
- Languages/Frameworks:Typescript, NestJS, Next.js, Node.js
- Databases:PostgreSQL, Redis, ClickHouse
- Messaging:Kafka
- Protocols:REST, Socket.io
- Data & Analytics:Jitsu, ETL, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Grafana
- Infrastructure:Kubernetes, Redis, Cloudflare
- Communication:Twilio
- Containerization:Docker
- Security:JWT, Auth0
- Monitoring & Logging: Grafana, custom ETL, Mixpanel
- Design & Collaboration:Miro, Figma
- Development Tools:GitHub, Slack, Confluence, Jira, CI/CD pipelines

Qualifications
- 6+ years of backend development experience.
- Deep experience building and maintaining scalable microservices and APIs.
- Strong knowledge of Node.js and TypeScript in production environments.
- Experience working with distributed systems, message queues (Kafka), and real-time data.
- Solid understanding of database design, optimization, and data flows.
- Familiarity with cloud-native development and infrastructure tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
- Strong collaboration, communication, and mentoring skills.
- Gaming industry experience is a strong plus.

title: Business Analyst

description:
Sobre a YellowIpe
Temos a missão de inspirar a conexão da tecnologia com as pessoas, fomentamos o melhor de nossos profissionais através de nossa expertise em encontrar e atrair os melhores talentos para os melhores projetos. O Foco nas Pessoas, Colaboração e Comprometimento são os pilares que nos guiam nessa trajetória.
Junte-se à equipa amarela como MS Dynamics Solution Manager!
A função principal do SM é supervisionar todos os ângulos e aspetos de uma determinada solução.A definição de uma "Solução" pode enquadrar uma única aplicação, ou um conjunto de peças/aplicações que funcionam coordenadamente para atingir determinados objetivos de negócio.No caso desta consulta, a solução principal está baseada na plataforma Microsoft Dynamics, complementada com a plataformas de CPQ APPTUS e de Marketing Adobe Marketing Cloud.
Responsabilidades:
- Conhecer a evolução do(s) produto(s) junto do(s) respetivo(s) fornecedor(es), analisando as respetivas release notes, anúncios ao mercado e roadmap de produto, avaliando impacto na instalação do cliente e propor ações/roadmaps para sua implementação;
- No caso em que sejam necessárias iniciativas para operacionalizar essas novas versões, podem atuar como Business Analysts na construção dos SoWs, acompanhar os respetivos processos de Procurement e participar nas avaliações técnicas.
Requisitos:
- Experiência mínima de 10 anos na gestão de soluções/projetos complexos/programas com Metodologia de Gestão Waterfall.
- Serão valorizadas experiências anteriores em projetos realizados em colaboração com o Cliente e/ou experiência em implementação de Sistemas de CRM / Sales Management, nomeadamente no sector de energia e combustíveis.
- Adicionalmente será também valorizada a experiência em gestão de programas de transformação complexos, em que tenham sido utilizadas equipas multidisciplinares
- Expertise na solução Microsoft Dynamics, em particular nos módulos Sales e Services, em contexto de mercado B2B e B2C.
Informações Importantes:
- Modelo híbrido de trabalho. (Lisboa - 1 vez por semana presencial no escritório).
- Boas habilidades de comunicação em Português e Inglês.
Candidate-se para esta oportunidade através do nossowebsite! =)
