title: Business Analyst - CRC Reports
description:
Com mais de 17 anos de existência, somos uma Equipa especializada em Projetos de Consultoria em diversas áreas dentro do mundo das TI (Business Insights, Web & Mobile Apps, Project & Program Leadership e Product Strategy & Development).
Investimos diariamente para sermos uma das melhores empresas para trabalhar, tendo sido distinguidos no ranking do Great Place to Work com o 1º lugar na categoria das empresas com 100 a 500 colaboradores e melhor empresa na categoria de Liderança. Destacamo-nos pelas práticas de gestão positiva dos nossos Talentos e pelo elevado grau de compromisso sentido pela nossa Equipa.
Visita a nossa homepage e junta-te aos nossos Talentos!

Local: Lisboa (Híbrido)
DESCRITIVO DA FUNÇÃO:
A Mind Source está a reforçar a sua equipa de Project & Program Leadership, com um talento em Análise Funcional, na área de reporting CRC.
Perfil:- Licenciatura em Finanças, Informática, Gestão de Empresas ou área relacionada;- Experiência comprovada como Business Analyst ou função semelhante em ambiente de serviços bancários/financeiros;- Experiência em reporting regulamentar e projetos ligados ao CRC (Central de Responsabilidade de Crédito);- Conhecimento avançado do Microsoft Office (Excel);- Forte interesse em temas de report regulamentar bancário e análise financeira;- Experiência em programação SQL e SAS será valorizada;- Experiência mínima de 3 anos em análise de dados será valorizada;- Experiência na interação eficaz com diferentes áreas, e, partes interessadas;- Fortes capacidades analíticas e de resolução de problemas, atenção aos detalhes e precisão na elaboração de relatórios;- Capacidade de trabalhar colaborativamente em ambiente de equipa, gerindo múltiplas prioridades e projetos em simultâneo.
Responsabilidades:- Preparar, validar e submeter reports regulamentares ao Banco de Portugal (BdP), incluindo CRC, PARI-PERSI, PAY e outros reports obrigatórios;- Garantir a coerência e consistência dos diversos reports regulamentares, realizando cruzamentos e validações com as bases de dados internas.- Analisar e interpretar requisitos regulamentares emitidos pelo BdP, assegurando a correta implementação em colaboração com as equipas técnicas.- Identificar impactos de novos projetos internos nos reportes regulamentares, garantindo a adaptação e evolução dos processos de reporte.- Colaborar com equipas responsáveis por outros reports regulamentares, assegurando o alinhamento e reconciliação de dados entre diferentes reports.- Implementar controlos internos que garantam a qualidade e conformidade dos dados reportados.- Identificar e corrigir situações não conformes, propondo e implementando planos de ação corretivos;- Garantir o cumprimento dos controlos exigidos pelo BdP, preparando respostas a pedidos de esclarecimento e auditorias do regulador.- Participar na criação e otimização de novos processos de reports regulamentar, adaptando-se a alterações na legislação e exigências internas.- Contribuir para a melhoria contínua dos processos, promovendo a eficiência e precisão na submissão de reports.
Nota: Só serão validadas candidaturas com residência na área da Grande Lisboa.

Responsabilidades:
- Reunir e analisar os requisitos funcionais de diversas partes interessadas relacionadas com os Relatórios CRC e a conformidade com os regulamentos do Banco de Portugal;
- Desenvolver e documentar especificações funcionais que representem com rigor as necessidades do negócio e os requisitos de reporting;
- Realizar revisões e auditorias regulares dos relatórios para garantir a conformidade com as expectativas do Banco de Portugal;
- Facilitar a comunicação entre as unidades de negócio e as equipas técnicas para garantir o alinhamento com as metas e cronogramas do projeto;
- Fornecer formação e apoio aos utilizadores finais sobre a utilização adequada de relatórios e ferramentas desenvolvidos para relatórios de CRC;
- Manter-se informado sobre as regulamentações relevantes e os desenvolvimentos do setor para melhorar os processos de relatórios e garantir a conformidade contínua.
Nota: Só serão validadas candidaturas com residência na área da Grande Lisboa.
Quem Somos:
- Consultora de Tecnologias de Informação e Processos de Negócio
- Expertise nas áreas de Business Insights, Web & Mobile Apps, Project & Program Leadership e Product Strategy & Development
- 17 anos experiência
- + 200 Talentos
- Great Place to Work há 14 anos consecutivos
- 1º Lugar no ranking dos Best Workplaces IT Portugal 2024 – Melhor Empresa para Trabalhar em Portugal, no setor de IT - Distinguida pelo Great Place to Work Institute
- 41ª Melhor Empresa para Trabalhar na Europa 2023 – Distinguida pelo Great Place to Work Institute
- Prémio Liderança e Desenvolvimento Humano - Distinguida pelo Great Place to Work Institute
- Parceiros dos melhores fabricantes (SAS, OutSystems, Microsoft)
- Prémio Inovação SAS
- OutSystems Innovation Award
Porquê a Mind Source:
- Contrato de Trabalho
- Formação profissional credenciada
- Mentoring
- Acompanhamento nos projetos e aconselhamento de carreira - Talent Management
- Foco na progressão de carreira e crescimento
- Desenvolvimento de projetos inovadores e aliciantes
- Ambiente Jovem e Dinâmico
Benefícios Exclusivos:
- Seguro de Saúde
- Mensalidade do Ginásio (Urban Sports Club)
- Apoio jurídico-legal, nutricional e psicológico
- Benefícios extrassalariais
- E muito mais!

title: Data Engineer - DataBricks
description:
About YellowIpe
Our mission is to inspire the connection between technology and people, we foster the best of our professionals through our expertise in finding and attracting the best talent for the best projects. The Focus on People, Collaboration and Commitment are the pillars that guide us in this trajectory.
Join the yellow team as our new Data Engineer - DataBricks!
As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for understanding business and technological challenges, develop data pipelines tackling those challenges, and ensuring their smooth deployment.
You will as well be responsible of the applications of standard industry and within-the-company good practices, and the application and evolution of our various patterns.
Responsibilities:
Projects understanding and Communication:
- Understand problems from a user perspective and communicate to clearly understand the issue.
- Ensure the architecture provided by the Data Architect is clearly understood by yourself.
- Communicate with the Data Architect and your peers on the technical solution you’re developing and communicate with the Project Manager in charge of the project you’re working on.
Development:
- Write and communicate on new or updated interface contracts.
- Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, data lakes, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling.
- Develop data pipelines based on the defined architecture.
- Ensure the regular good practices are applied.
- Deploy requested infrastructure, particularly using Terraform.
- Make peer reviews and ask to your peers to review your code when merging a new version of the codebase.
Testing:
- Define tests with your project manager, based on the functional and technical requirements of the pipeline you’re developing.
- Perform those tests and communicate regularly on the results.
- Regularly summarize the results of your tests in a dedicated document.
Deployments:
- Present to the Data Architect in charge of the architecture, and the Lead DataOps, the development that was performed through our Deployment Reviews.
- Track and communicate on any potential errors in the entire period of active monitoring following a deployment.
- Ensure diligent application of deployment process, logging, and monitoring strategy.
Requirements:
- Proficiency with PySpark and Spark SQL for data processing.
- Experience with Databricks using Unit Catalog.
- Knowledge of Delta Live Tables (DLT) for automated ETL and workflow orchestration in Databricks.
- Familiarity with Azure Data Lake Storage.
- Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow or similar) for building and scheduling ETL/ELT pipelines.
- Knowledge of data partitioning and data lifecycle management on cloudbased storage.
- Familiarity with implementing data security and data privacy practices in a cloud environment.
- Terraform: At least one year of experience with Terraform and know good practices of GitOps.
- Additional Knowledge and Experience that are a Plus: Databricks Asset Bundles; Kubernetes; Apache Kafka; Vault
Personal Traits:
- Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and stakeholders.
- Proactive Ownership for the projects delivered by your team.
- A continuous eye for improvement on existing processes.
- Clear communication and collaboration skills.
- Excellent analytical / problem- solving ability.
- Demonstrated ability to manage your stress in an operational environment.
- Demonstrated ability to understand quickly business and technical requirements of a data pipeline that needs to be developed, and challenge potential misconceptions.
- The candidate should have worked in a Data Platform that was in an industrial scale.
Important informations:
- Remote (1x/month in the office) - Fatima - Leiria.
- Candidates must be living in Portugal.
Apply for this opportunity in ourwebsite! =)

Airbus pioneers sustainable aerospace for a safe and united world. The Company constantly innovates to provide efficient and technologically-advanced solutions in aerospace, defense, and connected services. In commercial aircraft, Airbus offers modern and fuel-efficient airliners and associated services. Airbus is also a European leader indefense and security and one of the world's leading space businesses. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions and services worldwide.Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise andexperience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.Founded in 2021, the Airbus Global Business Services (AGBS) unit will be contributing to Airbus’ global success and play a vital role in Airbus’ transformation journey instandardization, harmonization, digitalisation and automation of end-to-end processes (e.g.Procure to Pay) of all overhead functions. Our target is that siloed ways of working/ processes will be a relic of the past within the AGBS. To drive such culture change we are looking for candidates with pioneering spirit that make data-driven decisions and take responsibility for the best outcome of their internal customers. All while embracing a spiritof problem-solving and living the Airbus values: Customer focus, integrity, respect, creativity, reliability and teamwork.Our purpose defines why we exist: ‘We pioneer sustainable aerospace for a safe and united world’

descrição da função/job description

You will be working closely with Procurement business for the management and implementation of the procurement supplier master data digital solution in order to secure and improve procurement master data management, compliance and quality to support decision/strategy making by trusted and qualified data.

Project Management support for master data digital solution & quality projects

Translate, collect, consolidate and prioritize business needs

Define “High level functional business specifications" in alignment with business,

IT development teams and experts

nsure timely and high quality procurement master data services to support business strategy development and execution

Working with the development team to create conceptual data models and data flows and monitor the implementation

Initiate and lead improvement projects to support master data management in alignment with transverse stakeholders

Strong multifunctional Stakeholder & Network management

External service providers working for the area of responsibility are managed professionally

Provide guidelines and awareness for the procurement community

Project planning




Company/Department

Airbus has started its digital transformation, with the objective of optimizing operations and proposing new services, through the exploitation of data.


Data Governance enables Airbus to leverage the value of data for our digital transformation. The team achieves that by defining the procurement data governance and data quality frameworks, methods, and standards for business processes as well as IT solutions. We enable the designing of innovative data solutions along with new initiatives, consult projects and enforce data compliance together with our partners in Analytics, Business and Tech. We take advantage of standardization and democratization of data to allow data-driven decision making even faster and more often and to unleash the real power of data right from the start while being compliant

requisitos/requirements
To ensure success, you should have knowledge or appetite working with digital solutions & data, as well as strong communication skills to understand and to communicate to the business


Project, organizational and time management skills:

Project Management skills in an international environmentTo have strong coordination skills to handle complex projectsCommitted, responsible / Autonomous way of working


Technical & Analytical Skills:

Ability to translate business problems into meaningful insightsA good understanding of information management practices including information lifecycle management, data modeling and master data managementSAP MDG & ERP knowledge including master data structure / managementAdvanced troubleshooting skills


Communication and presentation skills:

Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication and presentation skillsStrong stakeholder management and customer oriented mindsetEnjoy working with others and have the willingness to learn more.


Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions.


Degree in Business/Data Administration with specialization such as information technology, statistical, data management or demonstrated previous experience in a similar position.A minimum of 3 to 5 year’s experience in digital, project or business data managementHands-on experience in skywise or equivalent would be a plus.Excellent command of English (written and verbal).French, German or/and Spanish would be appreciated.

oferta/offer

title: SAP P2P Consultant
description:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.
Unleash your creativity and passion for footwear in this project. Here, you will be part of a diverse team, driven by excellence and guided by values of respect and innovation, where each member plays a vital role in redefining industry standards. If this challenge sound interesting, apply!
We are looking for aSAP P2P Consultantto work in this project inAveiro / Porto(flexible hybrid).
Responsibilities:- Participate in the analysis of company business processes and contribute to Blueprint development;- Develop Functional Design Documents (FDD) and collaborate with ABAP developers for custom solutions;- Configure SAP S/4HANA for procurement processes;- Test configurations and custom developments and conduct functional and end-to-end testing;- Prepare user documentation and conduct user training sessions;- Provide go-live support and post-implementation assistance to business users;- Collaborate with other functional teams for seamless module integration;- Monitor and resolve issues related to procurement workflows and invoice verification.
Requirements:
- Practical experience with ERP for Retail, SAP FMS, or SAP S/4HANA Fashion and vertical business functionality;- Recommended experience working in fashion companies;- At least 7 years of SAP procurement experience focusing on P2P;- Participation in at least one full-cycle P2P implementation project;- Strong understanding of the Fiori platform and its applications for procurement;- Expertise in SAP S/4HANA Materials Management (MM) and P2P modules;- Knowledge of key P2P functions: Source-to-Pay, Purchase Requisitions/Orders, Supplier Evaluation, and Contract Management;- Experience with invoice verification and handling discrepancies;- Experience with EDI for supplier integration, including IDocs, SOAP, and oData;- Familiarity with P2P integration with other modules (FI-CO, SD, PP, LE, ATP);- Experience with procurement workflows and supplier contracts/agreements;- Analytical thinking and ability to suggest process improvements;- Experience preparing FDDs, user guides, and conducting user training sessions;- Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams;- Ability to read, write and speak English at a proficient level.
What we offer:
- Health insurance;- A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;- Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;- Remote onboarding process;- Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;- Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!Apply
If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate toapply here. You can also explore our content about the job markethere.

title: Especialista em Infraestruturas IT, Redes e Cibersegurança
Senior Cloud Engineer
Senior Software Product Developer – React, JavaScript, TDD/ATDD, XP
description:
Function:Front-End, Back-End, or Fullstack
Type of Contract:Freelancer
Duration:12 months (renewable)
Location: Lisbon (Hybrid - 1 to 2 days per week at the office)
Language: Fluent in Portuguese and English


About Us:
We are a forward-thinking technology company dedicated to delivering high-quality, scalable, and maintainable software solutions. Our team thrives on collaboration, innovation, and a passion for creating outstanding products that make a difference. We embrace modern engineering practices like Test-Driven Development (TDD), Acceptance Test-Driven Development (ATDD), Extreme Programming (XP), and mob programming to ensure robust and effective software delivery.

Job Summary:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Senior Product Developer, front-end, back-end, or fullstack, to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate has 10+ years of experience in software development, a deep understanding of React, JavaScript, TypeScript, and agile engineering principles, particularly TDD, BDD, XP and mob programming. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deliver top-notch software solutions while fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.
Applicants must reside within the designated area specified in the Location section. Only candidates who meet all listed requirements will be considered; applications that do not meet these criteria will not proceed to the next stage

Key Responsibilities:
- Design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications using React and JavaScript.
- Write clean, maintainable, and testable code following TDD/ATDD principles.
- Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to deliver high-quality features.
- Implement and advocate for XP practices such as mob programming, refactoring, and continuous integration.
- Conduct code reviews and mentor junior developers to uphold coding standards and best practices.
- Participate in planning and estimation sessions to ensure timely delivery of features and solutions.
- Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, ensuring system stability and performance.
- Stay up to date with the latest developments in React, JavaScript, and agile methodologies to continuously improve team performance.

Required Qualifications:
- 10+ years of professional software development experience.
- Strong proficiency in React and JavaScript (ES6+), and TypeScript.
- Demonstrated expertise in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Acceptance Test-Driven Development (ATDD).
- Solid understanding of Extreme Programming (XP) practices and mob programming.
- Experience with modern development tools, including version control systems (e.g., Git), build tools, and package managers.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
- Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience with state management libraries such as Redux or Context API.
- Familiarity with backend development and APIs (e.g., Node.js, GraphQL).
- Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
- Exposure to Agile frameworks such as Scrum or Kanban.
- Fluent in Portuguese and English

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Remote work options.
- A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
- Opportunities for professional growth and learning.
- Access to the latest tools and technologies.

How to Apply:
Submit your resume, cover letter,picture,  and portfolio (if applicable) through ourwebsite. Please include specific examples of your experience with React, JavaScript, TDD/ATDD, and XP in your application.
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity in our team. We look forward to welcoming a passionate and skilled programmer to our team!

title: Engenheiro de Cibersegurança (CE)
description:
A Dellent é uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.
A área das telecomunicações está em constante evolução. Se também gostarias de fazer parte deste movimento, este projeto poderá ser do teu interesse, já que aqui terás a possibilidade de contactar com um dos líderes na criação e distribuição de soluções fixas e móveis de televisão, internet, voz e dados a nível nacional.
Procuramos um(a) Engenheiro de Cibersegurança (CE) para integrar a nossa equipa neste projeto (híbrido flexível) a longo prazo em Lisboa ou no Porto.
O que esperamos de ti:
-Definir e implementar controlos de cibersegurança em soluções da organização;-Realizar testes a soluções de cibersegurança de forma a aferir as soluções que mais se adequam às necessidades e contexto da empresa;-Avaliar e implementar requisitos adicionais em soluções existentes, quer para implementação de novas funcionalidades, melhoria continua ou resolução de problemas;-Colaborar com as áreas para reconhecimento, identificação, caracterização de tecnologia e consequentemente risco de cibersegurança;-Gerir projectos e produzir documentação necessária para o seu acompanhamento;-Acompanhar a evolução do mercado em tecnologias de cibersegurança;-Alinhar a estratégia interna com as melhores práticas do mercado e tecnologias que proporcionem um aumento na visibilidade e consequentemente na mitigação de risco de cibersegurança-Comunicar os riscos, respetivas mitigações ou tecnologias que melhor se adequam às necessidades identificadas;-Contribuir, sempre que necessário, no processo de gestão de incidentes de cibersegurança;
O que procuramos:
-Formação Académica Superior Informática, Engenharias ou experiência equivalente;-Experiência relevante em áreas tecnológicas e/ou engenharia;-Experiência relevante na identificação, caraterização e gestão de riscos de cibersegurança (e.g. realização de avaliações de cibersegurança);-Experiência relevante em matéria de gestão de riscos tecnológicos;-Capacidade de liderança e trabalho em equipa;-Capacidade de gestão de conflitos e coordenação de grupos de trabalho multidisciplinares;-Capacidade de planeamento e organização;-Proatividade, pragmatismo e iniciativa;-Resiliência, adaptabilidade a mudanças e gestão de situações ambíguas;-Pensamento crítico e orientado a resultados;-Autonomia na tomada de decisão e resolução de problemas.Conhecimentos valorizados:-Conhecimento em tecnologias de segurança;-Conhecimento no setor das telecomunicações.
O que oferecemos:
-Seguro de Saúde;-Plano de formação ajustado e personalizado, com um orçamento para gastares nas formações e livros técnicos que considerares necessários;-Feedback constante e acompanhamento para que possas crescer profissionalmente;-Processo de onboarding remoto;-Eventos de equipa todos os semestres para que possas viver novas aventuras;-Descontos e ofertas exclusivas nos nossos parceiros;-Cultura de proximidade e transparência. As tuas ideias e necessidades são ouvidas e valorizadas por nós!
Se achas que preenches o perfil submete a tua candidatura onlineaqui.

title: Data Analyst
description:
A Randstad é a empresa mundial líder em talentos. Trabalhamos diariamente para encontrar as melhores oportunidades para os nossos candidatos, ajudando-os a alcançar o seu verdadeiro potencial. Queremos criar um impacto positivo na sociedade, proporcionando oportunidades equitativas para todas as pessoas, independentemente da sua origem, e ajudando-as a manterem-se relevantes num mundo do trabalho em constante mudança.
A Randstad encontra-se a recrutar um Data Analyst, com ambição de começar a desempenhar algumas função de data science, para uma empresa de referência no setor da saúde em Portugal localizada no Porto.

descrição da função/job description

Análise e Modelação de Dados - interpretar grandes volumes de dados clínicos, operacionais e financeiros para apoiar a tomada de decisões estratégicas.Desenvolvimento de Modelos Preditivos: Criar e validar modelos estatísticos e de aprendizado de máquina para prever tendências, otimizar processos e melhorar a eficiência operacional.Monitorização e Performance: Acompanhar a qualidade dos dados e a performance dos modelos, ajustando e refinando os algoritmos conforme necessário.Visualização e Comunicação de Dados: Criar dashboards e relatórios interativos utilizando ferramentas como Power BI, Tableau ou Python para visualização de dados, garantindo que informações complexas sejam apresentadas de maneira clara e acessível para diferentes áreas da empresa.Colaboração Interdepartamental: Trabalhar junto às equipas de tecnologia, operações, financeiro e gestão para identificar oportunidades de otimização e desenvolver soluções baseadas em dados.Conformidade: Garantir que os dados sejam armazenados e analisados de acordo com as regulamentações de segurança e privacidade, como o Regulamento Geral de Proteção de Dados (RGPD).Pesquisa e Inovação: Explorar novas tecnologias e metodologias para análise de dados, mantendo-se atualizado com as melhores práticas do mercado e sugerindo melhorias para a empresa.

requisitos/requirements
Formação em Data Science, Estatística, Matemática, Engenharia ou áreas similares.

Conhecimentos em Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow), R, SQL.

Familiarizado com ferramentas como Power BI, Tableau, Apache Spark, Hadoop.

Cloud Computing: AWS, Google Cloud ou Azure.

Capacidade analítica, pensamento crítico e boa comunicação para traduzir insights técnicos.

Interesse por inovação e aprendizagem contínua.

oferta/offer
Benefícios: Seguro de saúde e subsídio de alimentação

para se candidatar/to apply<endereço ocultado>location_DTS-2025-162209

title: Senior Project Manager
System Administrator (DevOps)
description:
Who are we:
Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.
We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.
With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.
Neotalent, the responsive people.
Find out more about us at<endereço ocultado>.
Role Overview:
We are looking for aSystem Administrator (DevOps)to integrate one of our biggest clients in the banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry. You will join an international and diverse team. (Lisbon - Hybrid)
What you will do:
- Requirement Gathering & Change Management;
- Collect and document technical requirements for system enhancements;
- Participate in the change request process for technical and functional updates;
- Testing & Delivery;
- Collaborate on technical testing to ensure smooth production delivery;
- Launch and monitor initiatives, ensuring timely follow-up;
- Issue Resolution & Process Optimization;
- Perform Level 3 support, analyzing reported issues, and identifying solutions or workarounds to minimize impact;
- Ensure resolution and follow-up with vendors or service providers;

title: Engenheiro de Identidade e Gestão de Acessos - IAM (IE)
description:
A Dellent é uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.
A área das telecomunicações está em constante evolução. Se também gostarias de fazer parte deste movimento, este projeto poderá ser do teu interesse, já que aqui terás a possibilidade de contactar com um dos líderes na criação e distribuição de soluções fixas e móveis de televisão, internet, voz e dados a nível nacional.
Procuramos um(a) Engenheiro de Identidade e Gestão de Acessos - IAM (IE) para integrar a nossa equipa neste projeto (híbrido flexível) a longo prazo em Lisboa ou no Porto.
O que esperamos de ti:
-Definir de estratégia transversal de IAM, colaborando com os principais stakeholders da organização;-Desenhar, implementar e gerir directórios e serviços de identidade;-Implementar tecnologias necessárias para centralmente integrar com os sistemas da organização na gestão deidentidades;-Garantir melhoria continua dos processos e experiência dos utilizadores;-Implementar controlos de acesso a aplicações, manutenção e atualização de directórios;-Gerir acesso e permissões, sempre que possível de forma automatizada;-Resolver desafios relacionados com as soluções de IAM, integrações, capacidades ou funcionalidades daplataforma central no âmbito da autenticação;-Implementar e manter a tecnologia para garantir a conformidade com auditoria e privacidade;-Gerir projectos e produzir documentação necessária para o seu acompanhamento;-Realizar testes a soluções de IAM de forma a aferir as soluções que mais se adequam às necessidades e contexto da empresa;-Contribuir, sempre que necessário, no processo de gestão de incidentes de cibersegurança.
O que procuramos:
-Formação Académica Superior Informática, Engenharias ou experiência equivalente;-Experiência relevante em implementação de soluções de Identity and Access Management (IAM);-Experiência relevante em gestão de projetos, nomeadamente de IAM;-Experiência relevante na identificação, caraterização e gestão de riscos de cibersegurança (e.g. realização deavaliações de cibersegurança);-Experiência relevante em gestão de projetos de IAM;-Experiência relevante em matéria de gestão de riscos tecnológicos;-Capacidade de liderança e trabalho em equipa;-Capacidade de gestão de conflitos e coordenação de grupos de trabalho multidisciplinares;-Capacidade de planeamento e organização;-Proatividade, pragmatismo e iniciativa;-Resiliência, adaptabilidade a mudanças e gestão de situações ambíguas;-Pensamento crítico e orientado a resultados;-Autonomia na tomada de decisão e resolução de problemas.Conhecimentos valorizados:-Conhecimento em tecnologias de segurança;-Conhecimento no setor das telecomunicações.
O que oferecemos:
-Seguro de Saúde;-Plano de formação ajustado e personalizado, com um orçamento para gastares nas formações e livros técnicos que considerares necessários;-Feedback constante e acompanhamento para que possas crescer profissionalmente;-Processo de onboarding remoto;-Eventos de equipa todos os semestres para que possas viver novas aventuras;-Descontos e ofertas exclusivas nos nossos parceiros;-Cultura de proximidade e transparência. As tuas ideias e necessidades são ouvidas e valorizadas por nós!
Se achas que preenches o perfil submete a tua candidatura onlineaqui.

title: Especialista em Threat Hunting
description:
A Dellent é uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.

O que procuramos:
-Formação Académica Superior no ramo ou experiência equivalente;-Experiência mínima de 5 anos na área de Cibersegurança, de preferência em funções equivalentes;-Experiência em Threat Hunting, Threat Intelligence e Resposta a Incidentes;-Conhecimentos em ferramentas como SIEM, EDR/XDR ou similares, e frameworks como MITRE ATT&CK;-Capacidade analítica e abordagem metodológica para resolver problemas complexos;-Experiência em scripting (Python, PowerShell) e análise de logs;-Capacidade de comunicação para público técnico e não técnico;-Elevado grau de autonomia, responsabilidade, proatividade e dinamismo;-Pensamento crítico e orientado a resultados;-Capacidade de liderança e trabalho em equipa;Conhecimentos valorizados:-Certificações como GCFA, GCTI, OSCP ou equivalentes;-Experiência em ambientes de grande escala ou telco;-Conhecimentos em análise de malware e reverse engineering;-Conhecimento profundo e de baixo nível de sistemas operativos (Windows e UNIX).
O que oferecemos:

title: .NET Backend Engineer
description:
Start your exciting journey with Aubay right here:
Aubay Portugal is a subsidiary of the multinational French company, Aubay Group, present in Portugal since 2007. With offices in Lisbon and Porto, we are a leading provider of consulting services, specializing in the management, implementation, development, and maintenance of information systems.
Our expertise spans a wide range of industries, including banking, insurance, telecommunications, energy, transportation, and services, where we collaborate with over 150 active partners to deliver innovative, tailored solutions.
At Aubay, we’re committed to empowering businesses through digital transformation, offering cutting-edge technology and deep industry knowledge to drive success.

What are you going to do:
- Develop, enhance, and maintain scalable backend solutions using .NET 6+ and C#, following a DDD (Domain-Driven Design) approach within a microservices architecture.
- Build reliable and high-performing .NET WebAPIs, integrating Entity Framework, Dapper, LINQ, and raw SQL for efficient data handling.
- Write clean, maintainable, and testable code with solid unit test coverage using xUnit.
- Contribute to and maintain technical documentation to support development, reporting, and knowledge sharing.
- Work collaboratively with Product Owners, Developers, and UX/UI Designers to ensure alignment between business needs and technical solutions.
- Participate in cross-functional collaboration to integrate DevOps practices into the software delivery lifecycle.
- Use Jira and GitLab for project management, version control, and seamless team collaboration.
- Contribute actively to an Agile development environment, helping deliver high-quality solutions through iterative cycles.

What we are looking for:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field.
- 3 to 5 years of hands-on experience with .NET (6 or above), C#, WebAPI, Entity Framework, LINQ, and SQL.
- Strong skills in database design and modeling, with SQL Server experience (PostgreSQL is a plus).
- Familiarity with automated unit testing, preferably using xUnit.
- Good understanding of DevOps principles, including CI/CD workflows.
- Practical experience with Jira, GitLab, and GitHub.
- Comfortable working in Agile teams, with a focus on collaboration and incremental delivery.
- Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to solving technical challenges.
- Excellent communication skills, able to explain ideas clearly and work well with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
- Fluent in English, both spoken and written.

What do we offer you?
At Aubay, we believe in creating an environment where both your career and well-being thrive. Here's what you can expect when you join us:
- Health Insurance: Your health and well-being are a priority.
- Feedback&Coffee: A unique system that integrates Aubay's Performance Management Cycle with regular feedback sessions and a Career Progression Model, designed to foster your growth and success.
- Working Model: Hybrid model with office in Lisbon.
- A Tailored Training Academy: We’re dedicated to your professional development with both technical and behavioral training. From e-Learning and classroom sessions to Meet&Techs, Webinars, and Mentoring, we provide a variety of learning opportunities to suit your needs.
- Exciting Events & Teambuilding: Enjoy a vibrant company culture through regular events and team-building activities that strengthen relationships and enhance collaboration.

What makes us different?
At Aubay, we foster a unique environment where people come first. Here’s what makes us different:
- A Culture Built on Core Values: Our organizational culture thrives on transparency, team spirit, regular feedback, and continuous learning — all designed to support your personal and professional growth.
- Recognition & Rewards: Enjoy reference prizes and a birthday gift as a token of appreciation for being part of our team.
- Freedom in Expression: We embrace a casual dress code, allowing you to feel comfortable and authentic at work.
- A Friendly and Inclusive Atmosphere: At Aubay, we know your name, and we communicate informally — fostering a relaxed, close-knit environment.
- Grow with Us: You will grow alongside inspiring colleagues who support and challenge you. Isn't this the best way to develop professionally?

If we’ve sparked your interest, we’re now ready to ignite your enthusiasm. Are you ready for the first step?
We are waiting for you at <endereço ocultado>!

Randstad operates in Portugal and in the world as a leader in the area of Human Resources, in various sectors of activity. Technologies specialization works exclusively in the IT & Telecom sector, promoting unique professional development opportunities. As part of an internal and international project, we are looking for a Helpdesk with fluency in English, Portuguese and Spanish.

descrição da função/job description

Customer support desk within market locations, if any, for end-users:


Provide a first point of contact with DSM staff for users when necessary;Delivery of equipment, such as laptops, mobile devices, mice, loaner equipment;Resolution of simple incidents;Answering phone calls from internal customers;Assignment of incidents to team members.


Hands-on support at user’s:

Technical support that cannot be resolved by Global Service desk;Physical intervention / support required user’s desk (e.g. hardware support, display connectivity issues / dockstations, TV issues, software installation issues) Desktop, Laptop, mobile device (e.g. iPad, iPhone), support for Device preparation for new arrivals / damaged or defective equipment and replacement based on life cycle, which is generally 4 years for laptops and tablets, 3 years for cell phonesIncludes image installation / data backup as needed;Client/user operating system customization, printer installation, One-Drive configuration, and so on.

Delivery of devices to the end user, with simple training as required, and in the case of mobile devices, device activation, enrollment in the MDM tool;Dismantling / erasure / removal of the device;Occasional support on projects where additional device preparation is required;Piloting of new devices when necessary.

Network (WAN / LAN / WIFI) and telephony support:Planning, installation and maintenance of network and server room infrastructure, including cabling, racks, facilities, network ports and security features;Support to the NCC (Network Competency Center) and DCO (Data Center Operations) teams in network and server infrastructure implementations and troubleshooting;Preparation, configuration and delivery of telephony devices to end users (typically Plantronics, Polycom, Avaya devices, may vary from market to market) depending on technology and replacement on a lifecycle basis;Troubleshooting hardware problems in existing telephony systems and equipment and software problems with Skype for Business and MS Teams.

Data Centers:

DSM provides project support for data center activities for servers / storage (server / infrastructure migration, etc.).Coordination with third parties in the resolution of incidents.


Meeting rooms:

Maintenance of IT equipment in meeting rooms;Daily verification of the equipment in each room, including screens, telephone, Skype/Teams and videoconferencing equipment, flyers (user manuals);Videoconferencing support at the request of end users;Immediate support for incidents in conference rooms;Development / maintenance of manuals in the room.Support for rollout of new equipment/replacement conference room equipment, such as moving to new Skype room/Skype/MS Teams enabled systems

Printer Support:

Incident support, toner replacement, print solution troubleshooting support (most printers are Canon multifunction cloud printers, however, other types and personal printers can be found in certain markets/locations);In some locations, multifunction printers have “Electronic Maintenance” that automatically informs the equipment about toner replacement and automatically notifies Canon to come on site and repair/replace parts;Support all factory printers (e.g. Zebras, Epson, etc.) to perform some simple maintenance and debugging of applications (e.g. specific processes related to sales or logistics);Testing, installation, delivery and support of printers for Field Force. Full lifecycle management with printer manufacturer / supplier support.

Administrative tasks:

Inventory management of all equipment including laptops and cell phones for employee arrivals and departures. Facilitate notification of lost and stolen equipment to GSD and market/factory/source accounting;Activate / deactivate devices / numbers, receive / track equipment.

Factory / Leaf operational support:

Support related to hardware used in factory, e.g. thermal printers, fixed and portable scanners, vision cameras, sensors, RFID readers, scales (ADET, quality lab, purchasing station ...), QIMS devices (e.g. controllers, moxa), MALCAM (purchasing station, process line), GIMA support (remote network connection).

Local Application support:

Limited application support, e.g. eBuilder application, Uniflow printing, room wizard screens outside of meeting rooms, SharePoint applications, local databases, etc., that require occasional reboot / configuration change;Note: There is no full-time development requirement, but the ability to provide minor ad-hoc development capabilities and understand application development processes could be helpful;Maintenance / renewal of software application licenses (ThinkCell, Photoshop, etc.).

Global Applications support:

Very limited support of global applications, typically embedded in the workstation image, such as Microsoft Office, MS Visio, MS Project, SAP client, Adobe, SnagIt—requiring occasional reboots / upgrades / reinstallations / manual deployments or configuration changes in case of inability to do it remotely by GSD or GSM (Global Software Management) groups.

Training and communications support:

Prepare a limited number of communications to end users related to outages, changes, upgrades. Specific formats must be followed; native English and a good sense of how to communicate messages simply to non-technical end users are required;Occasionally organize limited and simple trainings for end users in a small group or individual session on specific topics as needed (e.g. new video conferencing equipment, Skype meetings);Note: This does NOT include training on tools such as “Excel” and PowerPoint courses, which are organized through our Human Resources department;Development / contribution of Knowledge Base articles when necessary.

Project support:

Some activities are required by the DSM team, such as office relocations, support for software upgrades or solutions such as deployment of MS equipment where local involvement is low but full knowledge is required.

Customer Satisfaction Management:

The process of logging incidents, changes, and problems through ITSP IM (incident management) and SRM (service request management), which are transmitted to users with feedback;Collect and analyze feedback from users and stakeholders;Implement improvements for identified problem areas;Discover and redirect IT teams to points for improvement;Advise GSD and IT on user-oriented operational improvement actions.

New Technologies and Innovation:

In case of technological changes in the company, acquire the appropriate knowledge for user support;Keeping track of new trends in the IT field and proposing innovative solutions to improve business processes.

IT Compliance and Security Audits:

Workstation patching and auditing of Data Center, network, and accounts, etc.

requisitos/requirements
Technical professional with L1/L2 support experience in a customer-facing, on-site role;

ITSM tools: ServiceNow/JIRA;

Strong knowledge of networking technologies, including Meraki, CISCO, FORTI, etc;

Experience required: a minimum of 10 years in customer support, with 5 years specifically in networking. At least 5 years of experience working within multinational companies, with a preference for those in the tobacco industry;

Fluency in English, Portuguese and Spanish

oferta/offer
Entry into a stable project with continuity in a prestigious company.

para se candidatar/to apply<endereço ocultado>location_DTS-2025-162076
